"Come, you have comprehended it. Come, sometimes the high lose it while the low attain it; sometimes the low lose it while the high attain it; sometimes both high and low lose it while the middle attain it; sometimes the middle lose it while both high and low attain it. Sometimes the writings of celestial spirits lose it, while the writings of sages attain it; sometimes the writings of sages lose it, while the writings of worthies attain it; sometimes the writings of worthies lose it, while the writings of the common people attain it; sometimes the writings of the common people lose it, while the barbarians attain it. Sometimes the inner loses it while the outer attains it; sometimes the outer loses it while the inner attains it. Where there is loss, there is also attainment. Thus, whether high or low, outer or inner, noble or base, distant or near, gather their writings and essential sayings, collect their strengths and shortcomings, arrange them by category to complement one another, and all will be complete. Then the written records and spoken words will be entirely comprehensive. Do you understand, Perfected One?"
"Understood."

"Now act upon it, for you have already understood. Heaven and Earth give birth to all matters, to people, sages, and the myriad creatures—each has its strengths and weaknesses, each has what it lacks, each has what it loses. Thus, what they do and create differs in myriad ways, yet in their essential aims, all desire to attain the heart-mind of Heaven and Earth and find peace for themselves.

Yet in that moment, each claims its own way as right, each holds its own truth as absolute. And in doing so, all stray from the heart-mind of Heaven and Earth. Thus, there is always an excess of disasters and harms, now great, now small, flowing ceaselessly—this is the clear proof. Therefore, the burden of *chengfu* is borne, and the suffering of later generations grows ever more severe.

Do you understand, Perfected One?"
"Understood."

"Go forth, for you have already grasped it. Thus, now Heaven has sent me down to re-examine the teachings of literature and instruction as the Dao Lord of Supreme Virtue, and I have gathered them all together. From the words of spirits and sages down to the common people, slaves, and barbarians, I have arranged them by category, compiling their sayings. The good are made into the *Dongji* scriptures, named *The Writings of August Heaven’s Governance of the Utmost Extremes*. Thereafter, the illnesses of Heaven and Earth will be entirely eradicated.

Do you understand, Perfected One?"
"Understood. How excellent! How excellent!"

"Go forth, Perfected One, for you have now awakened to the arising of affairs and already comprehend them. Heaven has granted you longevity and raised you to the rank of Upper Perfected One."

"Unworthy, unworthy."

"You have attained this by your own conduct, not by my power. You have done good, and none in the world can compare, thus Heaven cherishes you."

"Unworthy, unworthy. This foolish one has only refrained from angering Heaven, nothing more can be hoped for."

"Do not be discontented."

"Understood, understood. [Rises] I venture to ask: in gathering these various categories to arrange them together, I wish to hear the essential meaning."

"Good! Well asked! Has Heaven indeed prompted you to ask this? Very well. Be seated, and I shall distinguish and explain the Dao for you."

"Understood, understood."

"Consider this: suppose we take the character *jia* as an example—this represents one matter. When presented before the multitude of worthy and enlightened ones, it becomes fitting for the written records of the world, the words of all people. Each has their own sayings. Among these, take the faultless writings, the faultless words, and select the most excellent, gathering those that first resolve the hearts of the multitude. By mutually verifying and illuminating them, what arises in accord with the hearts of people is also in accord with the heart of Heaven and Earth."

"How is this made clear? I wish to hear the essential method."

"Very well. In all human conduct, when examined in the heart and found to accord with the hearts of the multitude of worthy sages, and all declare it good, then its resonance immediately accords with the heart of Heaven. When examined in the heart and found doubtful, then compared with the hearts of the multitude of worthy sages, down to the hearts of petty people, and all declare it not good, this is inauspicious. Heaven ultimately responds to it with inauspiciousness—this is the clear proof. Thus, gathering these sayings to form the scriptures, what unites the hearts of people is right; what does not unite the hearts of people is wrong. Do you understand?"

"Understood, understood."

"Go forth. In all written records and all affairs, each has its root. Following the root and harmonizing the words of the multitude of literati, explaining them in this way—what accords with the hearts and minds of people also accords with the spirits and deities. What does not accord with the hearts and minds of people does not accord with the spirits and deities."

"Excellent! Excellent! Your instruction has been received."

"Why now, Perfected One, do you say 'instruction has been received'?"

"Indeed, when conduct is good and upright, one gains the heart of Heaven and lives. When conduct is evil, one loses the heart of Heaven and meets an inauspicious death. This life and death belong to the decree of fate. Thus, I say 'instruction has been received.'"

"Excellent! The Perfected One speaks truly. I have nothing to add."

Thus, when Heaven rectifies one’s words and writings, there is good fortune; when it does not rectify them, there is misfortune. This is why I instruct the Perfected One to examine and correct them.

“Indeed, indeed.”

Only then does the qi of the Grand Supreme August One arise and extend life come forth. Yet even the words of celestial texts and sagely writings vary in length. Therefore, the qi of the Grand Supreme August One, imprisoned by perverse phrases and erroneous speech, has never been able to arrive. Since the opening of Heaven and Earth, there has never been a time when the qi of the Grand Supreme August One came to assist emperors and kings in governance.

Now, Heaven desires to fully release it, and so examines and corrects written works. For every perverse word that remains, there is one lingering illness; for every perverse doctrine or erroneous text that remains, there is one lingering illness. Ten perverse words leave ten illnesses, a hundred leave a hundred, a thousand leave a thousand, ten thousand leave ten thousand—each following these residual perverse words, perverse texts, and erroneous phrases to become illness. Heaven and Earth are afflicted by them, and thus cause people to be afflicted as well. If people are free of illness, then Heaven is free of illness; if half of the people are ill, then half of Heaven is ill; if all people, great and small, are ill, then all of Heaven is ill. Thus, when people fall ill, it is to awaken their joy; yet if they do not awaken, they die in countless numbers.

[End]

[Addendum]
I ask: when the multitude of categories are harmonized and aligned, then rectifying one’s words brings good fortune, while failing to rectify them brings misfortune. Only then does the qi of the Grand Supreme August One swiftly arrive.

When people fall ill, they all wish to quickly correct themselves for the better. When Heaven and Earth are ill, they too wish to quickly correct themselves for the better.

“I wish to hear: how do perverse words, perverse phrases, and perverse texts cause Heaven to fall ill?”

“Alas! Why do you remain so benighted and foolish? Sit properly, and I will explain it to the Perfected One.

When perverse words and perverse texts are used to expound the Dao and the scriptures, they disorder the Dao and the classics. When the Dao and the classics are disordered, the celestial patterns and earthly principles are disordered. When the celestial patterns and earthly principles are disordered, Heaven and Earth fall ill. Thus, the Three Luminaries, winds and rains, the four seasons, and the Five Agents engage in constant strife, and the year becomes inauspicious. Emperors and kings grow anxious and distressed, the government falls into chaos, and the people suffer from resentment, hunger, and cold—is this not the illness caused by perverse texts and perverse words? If they are widely employed, they lead to great disorder and ungovernability.

Do you understand?”

“Indeed, indeed.”

When perverse texts, perverse words, and erroneous phrases are used to govern the state, day by day they bring disorder. When such perverse words, perverse phrases, and erroneous texts deceive the ears, the state falls into peril, ministers distort the law and act recklessly, and the people suffer hardship and poverty, all together defiling the governance of Heaven and Earth. The celestial officials grow furious, and their daily admonitions never cease; the people’s weeping and cries of injustice likewise never cease.

Do you understand?”

“Indeed, indeed.”

When perverse words, perverse texts, and erroneous phrases are used to govern the household, fathers and sons, husbands and wives fall into disorder, growing to hate one another, and their constant quarrels never cease, thus becoming a household of misfortune. Do you understand?”

“Indeed, indeed.”

How grave this is! Hearing the Celestial Master’s words, I am truly terrified and alarmed. My foolish self did not reflect deeply and did not realize that such evil brings this upon us.

“You, Perfected One, have been foolish for far too long. The common people regard these as trifling matters and do not cast them aside, yet they do not know that these perverse words, perverse phrases, and perverse texts are the great adversaries of Heaven and Earth, the great bandits of the state, and the fierce ghosts of the hundred clans. How can they not be wholly cast out and strenuously eradicated? Therefore, Heaven cherishes the ruler of supreme virtue, fearing that he may not awaken, and that this great calamity may befall him. Thus, it has sent me down to expound upon this in full. Perfected One, swiftly commit these words to writing and disseminate them, so that he may urgently ponder the will of Heaven and thereby secure his own peace. If he does not, Heaven’s wrath will never cease. Thus, Heaven no longer sends sagely men to speak, for even they cannot entirely eliminate this affliction. Therefore, it causes all under Heaven to speak with one voice and together examine the ancient texts. Now, Heaven’s accumulated fury and resentment are directed at these perverse words, perverse texts, isolated speeches, and solitary flattering phrases. If you, Perfected One, wish to understand this, it is comparable to the emperor’s anger when the barbarians repeatedly come to harm his people. Thus, he dispatches a million soldiers to strike them down. If the affliction does not cease, his wrath will not subside. If the rewards for merit do not assuage his anger, the emperor will reconsider. Now, the examination of perverse texts is like this. Do you understand?”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“How awe-inspiring—all under Heaven is now rectified!”
“Perfected One, you may indeed be said to understand! Now, these solitary phrases, these isolated perverse words and perverse texts—Heaven and Earth regard them as the greatest grievance, the greatest enemy of the emperor. From them arises all disorder, all unrest in governance. Therefore, they must now be severed: let all utterances, all doctrines, all memorials be gathered and examined to settle and secure affairs. Only then will the qi of Heaven at last be wholly restored to its proper place, and perverse words and perverse phrases at last wholly eradicated—utterly destroyed. From this day forward, Heaven will cause men to examine them, and the spirits will also proceed to examine them. There will be no respite, no moment of slackening—only unrelenting urgency. Do you understand?”
“Indeed, indeed. This humble student is deeply ●.”
“If you understand ●, you may be spared further examination.”
“Indeed, indeed. This humble student falls short in every matter and bears grave transgressions before Heaven and Earth, causing the Heavenly Master concern. I have already taken heed of these perverse texts and perverse phrases, the words of solitary men. Now, I humbly request to receive further admonitions and strictures, the utmost warnings that accompany the arrival of rectified texts.”
“Excellent! The written word has now matched the spoken.”

“Why do you ask again of your own accord?”
“This benighted one remains obstinate and dull—though my heart seeks clarity, I still fail to grasp it. If I do not repeatedly receive your enlightening admonitions, I remain in murky confusion, risking further disorder to the Heavenly Master’s Dao. That is why I dare not refrain from asking again.”
“Excellent, your words. Very well, be seated, and I shall expound fully for all the assembled Perfected Ones.”

*[The discourse begins:]*
Now, true words, true texts, and true phrases are the very root of Heaven and Earth, the treasured vessel and parents of the state’s peace, and the source from which all people and the myriad things receive their mandate. Thus, one must strive with all one’s might to rectify them.
*[The discourse ends.]*

“Indeed, indeed. I wish to hear in full how true words, true texts, and true phrases serve as the root of Heaven and Earth, the state’s treasured vessel, and the decisive mandate for all people and the myriad things.”
“Ah! You have heard these words repeatedly, Perfected One. In my writings, all is afflicted with the sickness of frivolous, perverse speech—why then do you ask again?”
“This humble student has followed the common ways, accumulating ignorance over time. I do not know where perversity ends, and thus I must repeatedly receive your strict and clear explanations, for I remain utterly perplexed.”
“Very well. If you wish to know the truth of the matter: when common people all speak of goodness and strive together to practice it, yet disasters persist without cease, it is because perverse texts and perverse words have caused the disorder. When common people say, ‘This will suffice,’ yet cannot achieve goodness, but by adhering to and practicing it, they instead align with Heaven, and disasters daily recede—this is the work of true texts, true words, and true phrases, which alone inwardly correspond with Heaven, manifesting the clear proof of Heaven and Earth’s intent. Thus, true words and true texts reveal the rectified heart of Heaven and Earth.

Therefore, when all speech is true, all texts are true, and all phrases are true, and the emperor adheres to and practices them, extending this to the lowest of the people, none will fail to delight in practicing rectitude. Heaven and Earth will then achieve great rectitude, the four seasons and five phases, and the myriad things, all at once, will each attain their proper place. The sun, moon, and three luminaries will uphold their measures, each attaining rectitude. The state will enjoy great peace without care, and this will reach even the spirits, who will bestow the formula for agelessness. Marvelous things and auspicious responses will all emerge, while treacherous deceit and malevolent omens will be utterly destroyed. The people will each preserve their households and complete their allotted years, and the myriad things will all attain long life and fulfillment, each in its proper season. This is the great and luminous efficacy of true words, true texts, and true phrases—as the root of Heaven and Earth, the state’s treasured vessel and parents, and the mandate of the people and the myriad things. Do you understand, Perfected One?”
“Indeed, indeed. How ● it is!”

“How wondrous! The root of Heaven and Earth, the state’s treasured vessel—its mandate lies precisely here!”

“Excellent. You may be called one who understands matters, for you have grasped it. Thus did Heaven send me down to examine and rectify all things. Since the opening of Heaven and Earth, those who practice the true Way and speak true words in true texts—Heaven and Earth have ever rejoiced greatly in them, and thus they are ever blessed. Those who practice the perverse Way and speak perverse words in perverse texts—Heaven and Earth have ever been enraged and displeased by them, and thus they are ever inauspicious and unstable, often facing peril and ruin.

The common folk do not recognize this as the great affliction of Heaven and Earth, yet it disrupts the governance of emperors and kings. The benighted scholars below, in their cunning craft, compose treatises and records, practicing perverse words and perverse texts to vie for superiority, to deceive their superiors, to defile Heaven’s true Dharma, and to disorder Heaven’s true rites. This is the great grievance of Heaven, the great fault of Earth, and the great treachery against the state.”

“Now, having incurred the grievance of Heaven, the fault of Earth, and the treachery against the state, yet daily practicing such things—how could governance ever be peaceful? Today, the Celestial Master condemns these perverse words and perverse texts—how severe is their crime?”

“Alas! Perfected One, are you truly so foolish? When people together employ perverse words and perverse texts to disorder Heaven and Earth, Heaven and Earth are thus constantly afflicted—is this not the grievance and fault of Heaven? It is like one who constantly harms others—would they not also incur their grievance and fault?”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“Thus, it is clear that this is the grievance of Heaven and the fault of Earth. Now, perverse words, perverse texts, and perverse phrases have already deceived their superiors and endangered the state. Their governance constantly loses the favor of Heaven, their lifespans do not increase, and those who perish because of this are many, not just one. Is this not the great disgrace of the state? Do you, Perfected Ones, understand?”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“In later ages, people are often foolish—some observe the celestial patterns yet speak contrary to them. Such words are nothing less than the chief instigators of treason against the state, the greatest grievance of Heaven and Earth, the gravest harm to the people, and the fiercest demonic forces among the ten thousand things. Virtuous ruler, be vigilant and never adopt such words. Those who employ them incur Heaven’s resentment and stray from rectitude. You must weigh deeply and plan far ahead, reflecting on their perils and harms to secure lasting peace. Heaven has bestowed special favor upon you, virtuous ruler, and thus has composed these teachings to ensure your safety and the preservation of your state. Do you, Perfected Ones, understand?”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“Go forth, for you have now attained great awakening. Be ever cautious, be ever cautious—Heaven’s majesty must not be transgressed.”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“Let this be a warning to you, Perfected Ones: henceforth, the virtuous ruler shall carefully examine and ponder the celestial teachings and celestial patterns. When receiving memorials jointly submitted by the three ranks of officials and commoners, by the eighth month, gather and collate them, dividing them into three sections. The initial collation shall take place in the eastern hall of the ruler’s palace—this shall be the first transmission. The subsequent collation shall be conducted in the southern hall—this shall be the second transmission.”

“Transmit and collate in the western hall of the ruler—this shall be the third transmission. Those who have completed the collation shall depart to the northern hall of the ruler.”

“Why must the collators be stationed in separate halls and not observe one another’s work? We wish to understand.”

“Even so, if they were to see one another, deceit might arise, and falsehoods could be concealed, leading to further fraud. Such resentment would provoke Heaven and Earth, becoming the greatest scourge to the state. Heaven and Earth despise such men, and thus the Emperor governs disorder. Therefore, they are kept apart, and the three collations are conducted to verify the truth together. This resolves the will of Heaven and secures the governance of the king.”

“Why must the first collation begin in the eastern hall?”

“The East is where the qi of Heaven holds its intent and benevolence. Those who collate the origins of affairs must apply careful consideration, exerting effort in benevolence to align with Heaven and Earth, ever mindful of stabilizing the Emperor’s rule—hence the East. The benevolent proceed with action, and thus must scrutinize clearly, which is why the transmission moves to the southern hall of the ruler. After scrutiny, judgments are made with righteousness, removing what must be removed. Those with merit are recorded as such, and those without merit are likewise noted, forming a record of conduct. These records are then stored in the northern hall, placed in a secluded chamber, so that the deeds of all under Heaven—knowing good and evil—are never lost. Thus, the virtuous ruler examines conduct, and this is called the great divine person, who sits and knows the hearts of all under Heaven, as well as every movement of change and anomaly. Do you Perfected Ones understand?”

“How profound!”

“How profound indeed!”

“If you understand and revere the discourse of Heaven, you shall live long.”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“From this point onward, officials no longer need speak of conduct records, for conduct records are manifest in this very system, and thus this shall serve as the record of conduct. Therefore, the virtuous ruler may rest his head upon his pillow in peace, without worry. Do you understand?”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“When Heaven commands the review of documents, if a single matter is omitted, thirty lashes shall be administered; if ten matters are omitted, three hundred lashes; if a hundred matters are omitted, three thousand lashes. The virtuous ruler shall dismiss such a person and bar them from office forever. This individual treats matters with frivolity—such is the resentment of Heaven and the blame of Earth, the great thief of the state. Resentment, blame, and thievery cannot long be endured in governance; they will surely provoke Heaven and Earth, and thus must be swiftly removed.”

“Excellent! Excellent!”

“Let me caution you, Perfected Ones, of one great essential: my written Dao flows from above to below without end. Those who cherish upright speech, upright words, and upright texts—I am deeply entrusted by Heaven to descend with this charge. Truly, Heaven cherishes upright speech, upright words, and upright texts, and thus detests with great vehemence perverse speech, perverse words, and perverse texts. It is precisely because Heaven and Earth abhor such resentment and blame that they have commanded me to descend and review, to remove this resentment, blame, and thievery, so as to pacify the state of virtue and power, and to dissolve the long-accumulated karmic retribution since the opening of Heaven and Earth. Let all harm depart and rest be attained, that the upright *qi* may fully advance and govern. Only then will the six directions, the eight distant realms, and the balanced *qi* of August Heaven all arrive in unison. Do you understand?”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“Thus, my texts are purely the words of Heaven, without deviation from their singular allotment. Heaven detests perverse texts, and so I detest them; Heaven cherishes upright texts, and so I cherish them.

Therefore, in my practice of the Dao, I wholly uphold the root, guard the center, and discard the branches. Heaven upholds the root, and so I uphold the root; Heaven guards the center, and so I guard the center; Heaven discards the branches, and so I discard the branches. My texts are thus of one body, one mind, one will, one allotment, one principle, one love, one aversion, one Dao, and one path with Heaven and Earth. Therefore, when the virtuous ruler employs them, there is not a single error. For ten thousand myriad ages they cannot be abandoned—only days of radiant clarity, with no time of darkness; only days of order, with no time of chaos; only days of goodness, with no time of evil; only days of fortune, with no time of misfortune. Thus it is called the ‘Utmost Correct Dao of Heaven’s Profound Extremity,’ embracing the heart of Heaven and Earth. Those who attain its highest secret may attain longevity; those who attain its middle secret become pillars of the state; those who attain its lowest secret may always dwell in peace.”

Here ends my brief discourse. If you have doubts, return again to ask.

“Indeed, indeed.”

“May I ask: if one inadvertently omits or errs in a single matter without cause, should they receive thirty strokes of the cane as punishment?”

“Excellent is your question, child! Has Heaven prompted your words? Indeed, numbers begin with one and end at ten. This error of omission in one matter thus concerns the very root of the One. Omission and error, if not truthful, become deceit—and deceit becomes Heaven’s resentment and Earth’s reproach, a great thief against the state. Ten strokes are to make amends to Earth; ten strokes, to make amends to the Emperor and Kings. Heaven, Earth, and humankind each receive ten, totaling thirty. These strokes atone for the transgression, dispelling Heaven’s resentment, Earth’s reproach, and the theft against the Emperor and Kings. Thus do Heaven and Earth rejoice, while the spirits’ wrath subsides.

The reason Heaven and Earth are often in turmoil and the spirits grow wrathful lies in the failure to verify documents and the prevalence of careless, erroneous speech—hence the succession of calamities and the burden of inherited misfortune. If such carelessness persists, punishment is warranted—not because of personal favor, but to rectify the matter.

Now, when deliberations are held and the facts are verified [for the upper record], it is marked as correct above; if further deliberations confirm [the lower record], it is marked as correct below. Thus, both upper and lower records are deemed true. If only the lower [record] is verified while the upper remains false, it is utterly without benefit; likewise, if only the upper [record] is verified while the lower remains false, it is also without benefit. Only when both upper and lower are true does Heaven’s qi attain balance.

If the lower is true but the upper is false, the upper wrongs the lower, and the lower wrongs itself—no good deed bears fruit, and Heaven’s wrath arises anew. If the upper is true but the lower is false, the lower wrongs the upper, and Earth’s wrath arises anew. Only when both upper and lower are entirely true, yet the Emperor and Kings do not govern with impartial reason, do the spirits of the four seasons, five phases, six relations, and the qi of the six ancestral temples grow restless, and inauspicious qi resurges. Even if one strives to circulate documents through the Three Dao to rectify the realm’s words and texts, without earnestly governing with impartiality, it is of no avail.

Therefore, I uphold Heaven’s will, enacting transformation for the August Virtuous Ruler of the Highest Sovereignty, never daring to stray from Heaven’s heart. Thus, I fully adhere to Heaven’s laws, taking the images of Heaven and Earth as the warp, following the yang as the standard, and aligning with the four seasons and five phases as the mandate—unchanging for ten thousand generations. Do you understand?”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“I, your humble student, have now awakened with reverence and hold the laws of Heaven in great awe.”

“Since you know to stand in awe of them, you have already secured lasting auspiciousness. This is a crucial admonition for the Perfected One. Now, regarding the collation of documents and laws: one must not merely assert that the numinous texts match their written forms, claiming this as truth—such is called ‘deaf script.’ Does speech truly lack a root or handle? Why would one speak thus? It does not restrain what exists. One must inquire into the intent behind the words; only when the intent is grasped can the matter be clarified. If the intent is not explained, how can it be understood? Therefore, one must question its resolution and meaning; otherwise, it cannot be employed—this is called ‘deaf governance.’

If you wish to delight in understanding intent, consider this: when a person speaks, there must be a foundation, a source from which it arises. One cannot simply say, ‘Eastern Duke spoke thus to establish the matter.’ All who testify to establish matters possess roots—how could they merely fabricate empty, baseless words? Thus, in all ordinary affairs, one must rely on actual evidence before a matter can be established.

Do you wish to know its great efficacy and clear proof? Consider how I, for the Virtuous Ruler, enact transformative laws—all are tested and verified in practice. If implemented and no response follows, it is false speech; if implemented and no response follows, it is contrary to Heaven. True speech and writing are like this. How can one idly establish proof and speak words without explanation?

Foolish people may stubbornly insist, ‘Why are the numinous texts and words like this?’—using them only as phrases to resolve difficulties and evade inquiry. What power do numinous texts possess? They may have intent, but merely transmitting their words without residing in a single volume, passing them along in isolation, people fail to deeply grasp their essential meaning. Instead, they use them to deflect difficulties, citing ‘Eastern Duke said long ago’ to justify themselves—this is false. All such cases lose the true intent. That the words of the Dao and virtue fail to circulate widely stems entirely from this.

Do you understand?”

“Indeed, indeed. Your humble student has now awakened with reverence.”

“If you had remained unaware in this way, you would have fallen into delusion. Therefore, when examining my writings, scrutinizing texts and human speech, one must thoroughly inquire into their intent. By what means can their meaning be obtained? By gathering them according to kind. Only then will the texts and words of the world, once fully explored, reveal the laws of Heaven’s Dao, and the words of good and evil be made clear.”

“Excellent! Excellent!”

“Go forth—my Dao is revealed here. Perfected One, reflect upon it again and again, mutually verifying and clarifying, and nothing will remain unresolved. All matters under Heaven will be complete, the Great Dao attained, Heaven and Earth pleased, and the Virtuous Ruler eternally secure. The world will speak with one voice, all saying, ‘Excellent!’ No longer will they speak of Heaven’s governance, for the hearts of Heaven and Earth will be regained—this is called peace. When all actions align with the hearts of ordinary people, the world will have no further words.

Do you understand, Perfected One?”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“Go. If minor discrepancies in the words leave you in doubt, return to ask again.”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“Herein lies the text of *The Scripture of the Cavernous Ultimate* on the harms of Heaven’s resentment, Earth’s reproach, and the state’s calamities. *Collated and Combined Scroll Ninety-Two of the* Classic of Great Peace*, Ji Section, Part Seven. Scroll Ninety-Two of the* Classic of Great Peace*: The One Hundred Thirty-Third Formula on the Eclipses of the Three Luminaries.”

“May I ask why the Three Luminaries of Heaven sometimes suffer eclipse?”

“Excellent! An excellent question indeed. This is the great wrath of Heaven and Earth, their struggle and disharmony, manifest in the signs of the sun, moon, and stars. Yet eclipses may or may not occur—the fault lies in the struggle of yin and yang qi.”

“Why do they struggle?”

“Yin and yang engage in mutual trespass, each vying for dominance. By nature, yin and yang ought to benefit and aid one another, together forming harmonious qi. Instead, they contend, and all fault lies in this lack of harmony and balance.”

“If they were harmonious and balanced, would there be no eclipses?”

“Indeed. In the most excellent age of the Great Cavern of High Antiquity, eclipses never occurred. But as later generations grew increasingly distant, they collectively lost the intent of Heaven and Earth, causing yin and yang to gradually cease loving one another—thus leading to their struggle. You may doubt my words, but if the Virtuous Ruler were to examine and enact my text, grasping its full meaning, the struggle would cease.”

“If one grasps a small portion of its meaning, the struggle ceases in small measure; if half its meaning is attained, it ceases by half. Yet if one does not vigorously enact it, one remains mired in distress.”

Someone asked: “When do the eclipses of the sun and moon occur due to the convergence of celestial movements?”

“Alas! How foolish you are! Even a Perfected One would only provoke Heaven’s wrath by raising such a question. How could you, a mere mortal, claim to know of celestial movements?”

“The unenlightened see only that they occupy the same space.”

“How benighted is your mind—so profoundly obscured! If we follow your reasoning, then indeed eclipses would be mere convergences of movements.”

“Then why, within a single year, do the sun and moon eclipse without resolution? Or why, in some years, do they not eclipse at all? How can celestial movements explain this? When emperors and kings abundantly practice the Dao and virtue, the sun and moon do not eclipse, and the stars do not disrupt their courses. How can this be? Moreover, by nature, yin and yang share the same realm and ought to love one another—why then do they harm each other? Yin and yang should alternately generate and bring each other to fruition—why instead do they turn to mutual destruction?”

“This is the folly of your ignorance. If you wish to know the truth, consider the analogy of men. When people have long been close but have not seen one another for some time, upon meeting again, they rejoice greatly, aiding and benefiting each other, praising and illuminating one another. But if they have never been close, upon suddenly meeting, they contend. If their estrangement is great, they fight to the death; if slight, they quarrel in small measure.”

“How terrifying! How terrifying!”

The fool has now understood. I ask: today the sun is the spirit of fire, of yang; the moon is the spirit of water, of yin. Now water and fire do not share the same realm, and when they meet by chance, they extinguish each other—what does this mean? Is it not because they are not close?

Excellent! Your words grasp the meaning. Yet water and fire each follow their own Dao, abide by their own courses, and when they harmonize, they establish merit and accomplish tasks. Consider the five phases: none can be absent, for all mutually generate and complete one another. If you wish to know the truth, compare them to the five viscera dwelling together in the human abdomen. The heart is fire, the kidneys are water—how could they share the same place yet daily engage in battle and mutual destruction? Do you now understand?

Indeed, indeed. The fool has awakened.

Thus, when the qi of harmony arrives, the Three Luminaries no longer contend or eclipse. Only when the Three Luminaries do not eclipse one another can one begin to speak of attaining the heart of Heaven and Earth, and this serves as proof. Therefore, if you wish to know your own worth, to practice virtue and the Dao, you must first observe this celestial evidence, rather than gathering mere texts that speak of mutual destruction in shared realms. Such records only preserve the words of mutual love, without deeply grasping their meaning. Even if divine texts exist, Heaven has not yet deeply revealed its true nature. Do you understand?

Indeed, indeed.

Go, you have now awakened. After my text is revealed, let virtuous emperors and kings ponder this celestial intent and not forget these words, for they are the means to attain the heart of Heaven. If one aligns with the intent of Heaven, one’s mandate will be long and whole; if not, it will disrupt the Gate of Destiny. To act without accord with the heart of Heaven is also a great peril. From the earliest antiquity, all sage emperors and kings have taken this as a warning, deeply inscribing my words in their hearts, so that subtle truths may be seen and the Dao attained. This I entrust to rulers of supreme virtue, to remedy the contention and eclipses of the Three Luminaries.

Indeed, indeed.

Go now, our brief discourse is complete. If you have doubts, return to ask again.

Indeed, indeed.

**The One Hundred and Thirty-Fourth Formula of the Twelve Thousand States: The Beginning of Fire and the Beginning of Qi**

Someone asked: "The world shares the same sun and moon, the same Dipper and Pole Star. One great division comprises twelve thousand states, the central division eighty-one regions, and each small division is a single state. Those of superior virtue expand their territory to twelve thousand *li*; the next, ten thousand *li*; then nine thousand, eight thousand, seven thousand, six thousand, five thousand, four thousand, three thousand, two thousand, one thousand, five hundred, and one hundred *li*. These are the lands of even and stable earth, where the expansion and preservation of territory depend on the superiority or inferiority of virtue. As for those of inferior virtue, they may possess not a single stretch of level land, all afflicted by calamities and transformations, causing the sun and moon of a single state to contend and eclipse. Among the twelve thousand states, would all necessarily suffer eclipse? If the Dipper and Pole Star grow dim, would all twelve thousand states necessarily lose their brightness?"

"Excellent! How profound, how distant, how subtle is your question! Why do you ask specifically about these strange and wondrous transformations? If one state undergoes change, what does it matter to the twelve thousand states? Should the others also be affected?"

"I found it strange and, not daring to presume upon the Heavenly Master’s wisdom, feared that without asking, the truth would remain unknown through all ages. Thus, I inquired."

"Excellent! Your doubt truly enters the Way. If one state undergoes change, only that state’s sun grows dim—this is called an eclipse. Neighboring states may observe it from afar, but the distant ones are certainly unaffected. If the Dipper and Pole Star grow dim, only those who have lost Heaven’s intent lose their brightness; the distant ones remain unobscured."

"Now I ask: what barrier or concealment causes this localized dimness?"

"Alas! You are still like an unopened child, no different from the common folk. Consider this: Heaven and Earth are separated by vast distance. In a state that has lost the Way and lacks virtue, perverse *qi* rises to obscure the sky. The Three Luminaries, each following their kind, ascend, but their light is dimmed. It is like a place shrouded in mist, where the Three Luminaries alone grow dim, while beyond the mist, all remains brightly lit. If you wish to understand further: in a shaded place, one does not see a lunar eclipse; in a sunlit place, one sees a solar eclipse. To confirm this truth, consider that in the current year, with Jupiter in the *zi* position, virtuous states alone enjoy prosperity, while those without virtue suffer misfortune. Though they share the same state and the same year, their fortunes differ. It is like people sharing the same Heaven and Earth, yet their safety or peril, their customs, are not the same. Do you understand?"

"Yes, yes."

"Excellent! Excellent!"

"Now, as the sun and moon move and shine, all twelve thousand states share them, yet where they are bright or dim differs. In states with the Dao and virtue, governance is pure and clear, tranquil and free from perversity—thus their Three Luminaries alone shine brightly, for the perverse *yin* *qi* below cannot rise to obscure them. Where they are dim, the fault lies below, where the lower deceive the higher, and perverse *qi* together ascends to veil what is above. In states without the Dao, governance is filthy and turbid, filled with treachery and self-deception—thus their Three Luminaries are dim.

Do you wish to confirm this further? It is like squinting at the sun versus gazing at it with eyes wide open; or like looking at the sun with eyes fully open versus through a thin veil of silk—this is precisely the case. Do you understand?"

"Yes, yes! How astonishing! How astonishing!"

"If you grasp this astonishment, you attain long life."

"Yes, yes."

"As for those states on the verge of misfortune and decline, their Three Luminaries are entirely dim. It is like a blind man who alone cannot behold the brightness of the Three Luminaries—the Three Luminaries remain as they are, yet because the man is blind, he alone does not see them. It is like one in the prime of life who alone perceives the brightness of the Three Luminaries, while the aged alone cannot perceive it—this is the effect of their flourishing or decline. Do you fully understand?"

"Yes, yes."

"Go now. I ask of one ultimate secret—what is it? And what, pray, is this 'One' that I do not yet clearly understand?"

"Ah! A true person clings to so many texts—why doubt this? Now you are lost in darkness. Know how to guard the One, and all matters are complete. Why do you ask such trifling questions? You should reflect on these words."

"Yes, yes."

"The One is the heart, the mind, the will. It is the spirit within this body. All affairs under heaven are accomplished through it. From ancient times to the present, the transformations of the worthy and the sagely—all their achievements and renown—are realized through this. For they knew early to study the heart and mind, to will and contemplate goodness, to guard virtuous deeds. Fools bring only misfortune upon themselves, for they study and guard evil deeds. The nature of heaven and earth is such that all crawling creatures are thus—therefore, if one follows a teacher’s instruction, longevity may be attained. What Dao is there to study? Heaven and earth may be grasped. Gathering a multitude of millions is not equal to serving one worthy person. A multitude of fools—millions of them—can only hasten misfortune and ruin. If one truly guards the body of a single worthy, what harm can come to oneself? If one cannot turn back and reflect, seeing one’s thoughts as if gazing into a mirror, then the will directed afar brings illness to the body, withering and decay in one’s affairs. But if the will is directed near, the body retains its luster. All that the will and thought accomplish are manifold—if one does not prepare and remember them, all affairs under heaven are thus. Do you understand?"

"Yes, yes."

“〈Question〉 May I ask: when drought and frost cause all to perish, and the people suffer, starving and freezing to death—what is this killing?”

“This is the killing of August Heaven’s Great Yang. When the six yangs are all resentful, they are capable of bringing harm.”

“What does this mean? I wish to hear it.”

“It is this: the six directions reach their utmost extremes, and within them, the Great Hardness is all resentful toward people for their long-standing chaos and evil—hence the killing. What harm does it bring to people? It has no name. It merely encounters the exhaustion of their inherited burdens, and Heaven’s wrath erupts. It does not distinguish between people’s good and evil—those who encounter it face great misfortune. If you wish to know its truth, compare it to a person. When a person is enraged to the utmost, they may vent their fury upon the good, not sparing them, and instead harm others at random. Now, what fault have those others committed? Yet they encounter the person’s wrath. Heaven’s wrath erupts in the same way. Thus, the responsibility of inherited burdens is most severe, causing people to die without regard for good or evil. The great calamity lies here. 〈End〉

Therefore, my scripture responds to Heaven’s teaching, now seeking to sever once and for all the responsibility of inherited burdens. Heaven’s transgressions run deep and heavy, harming many innocent people—Heaven grieves over this greatly. Thus, it has instructed me to charge the Perfected Ones to transmit this scripture to a ruler of supreme virtue, commanding that wicked, deceitful, and false people be cut off, so that Heaven’s Dao may be ordered. Do you understand?”

“Yes, yes.”

“May I ask: since the opening of Heaven and Earth, some have perished entirely from raging epidemics, some from floods, and some from warfare. I wish to understand the reason—what offense have they committed? Is it merely the conjunction of Heaven and Earth? Or is it the distress of inherited burdens?”

“Indeed. Ancient and modern texts often attribute this to the meeting of Heaven and Earth’s yin and yang, but this is incorrect. All such calamities arise from the distress of inherited burdens. When Heaven’s qi is in harmony, but its anger flares, and spirits and deities engage in battle, those who die from raging epidemics are struck down by Heaven. Those who perish in floods are struck down by Earth. Those who die in warfare are struck down by humanity.”

“May I ask why those who die from raging epidemics are slain by Heaven?”

“Heaven presides as the sovereign of spirits and the chief of divine beings, thus it commands spirits and ghosts to kill. Earth is the humble aspect of yin; water is the most intense aspect of yin and belongs to Earth. Yin governs gestation. When any being in gestation is harmed, it must turn to blood, and blood is of the same kind as water. Those harmed during gestation become enraged and displeased, further spreading their polluted blood to harm others. Water is the bloodstream of Earth, the yin of Earth. Yin, being humble, when enraged, must engage in battle and kill with its own body—just as a minister sent to capture bandits must act in person, not like a ruler who merely issues commands from afar. Harmony is governed by humanity, while the four seasons and five phases share in its regulation. People ought to act in accord with harmony. When they lose the Dao and fail to follow it, they provoke wrath. Thus, the four seasons bring perverse qi, and the five phases engage in battle, causing people to attack one another. All this arises from Heaven and Earth’s harmony turning to anger and displeasure, accumulating over time into illness and sorrow, leading to such outcomes.”

“Excellent! Had I not pressed with these questions, I would never have come to know this.”

“Would that I might hear fully of this calamity of mutual burden and retribution, which arises from the wrath of the three qi. Yet when there is no such mutual burden and retribution, how do people die?”

“Indeed, all human life has its end. The high, the low, and the middling each fulfill their allotted years. Some attain the true Dao and thereby transcend the world—such people bear no burden of retribution, for this is the natural principle. Do you understand?”

“Indeed, I do.”

“Excellent! You grasp it well. As for those who die suddenly, one after another, none of these deaths are fated. They are but the effects of Heaven and Earth’s harmony, the four seasons, and the five phases waging war in wrathful suppression and slaughter.”

“Excellent! Excellent! Had I not pressed the Heavenly Master with these questions, I would have had no way to know this.”

“Thus, since the opening of Heaven and Earth, this calamity has always existed, though people have remained unaware. Now, deeply grieved by this suffering, I lament that so many die without guilt, moving Heaven to compassion. Therefore, Heaven has sent me down to explain it fully. Once my celestial texts are put into practice, the people and all things will each die according to their allotted lifespans, and there will be no more mass deaths.”

“Excellent! Excellent!”

“Future generations will each fulfill their destinies. Do you, Perfected One, understand?”

“Indeed, I do.”

“You ask: if death does not come by the Dao of Heaven or the revolutions of fate, why then does it always arise at the junctures of Heaven and Earth, at the confluences of the five phases? Is it because the spirits of the Five Emperors have exhausted their cycles and fallen into distress?”

“Ah! Excellent! Such a probing question from the Perfected One! Has Heaven itself prompted you to ask this? Your words strike the very heart of celestial prophecy—what a singular and crucial inquiry! I am most delighted. Since you have spoken thus, I shall now set forth a detailed explanation for you.

All you Perfected Ones have come from afar to inquire on behalf of Heaven and Earth, to resolve doubts that have lingered since the opening of Heaven and Earth and the rise of emperors. You should sit calmly and listen to my words.”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“Now, the law of Heaven and the reckoning of the people and the myriad things are thus: consider the qi of the four seasons, which ought only to succeed one another in generation and completion, passing along in turn. Consider human life: the young will in time grow old, succeeding one another in alternation. They ought not to engage in struggle and war, thereby cutting off and extinguishing the generations.

The reason the Dao wages war—bringing floods, droughts, pestilence, and mass death—is that the lord of men, following the ways of former kings and ancestors, gradually loses the intent of the Dao. Over time, this accumulates until the juncture arrives, and he fails to measure himself and act accordingly, thus bringing about total annihilation, leaving no remnant of the kind. Heaven, Earth, and humanity form the three norms, each depending on the others to stand, each shaping the others to completion. It is like a person with head, feet, belly, and body: if one norm is destroyed, the three norms all collapse in ruin. If a person lacks head, feet, or belly, and one is lost, then all three are imperiled.

Thus, when humanity greatly violates the great Dao, it brings ruin to Heaven and Earth, and the three norms perish. All becomes dark and confused, and the myriad things perish as a result. When things are utterly destroyed, they cannot suddenly regenerate. How much is lost? How much is extinguished? Sometimes recovery comes swiftly, sometimes great ruin endures for a long time before restoration is possible. Thus, minor destruction is quickly repaired.

If you wish to know the truth of this in greater detail, so that future virtuous rulers may clearly perceive the great effects of Heaven and Earth’s grievance, consider a household managing its livelihood: those with abundant stores, though they may encounter misfortune or suffer the burden of past transgressions in a year of poor harvest, will endure securely. A household with great stores, even if it suffers bad years in succession, will still survive. A household with modest stores, if it encounters years of poor harvest in succession, will starve to death. A perpetually impoverished household, if it suffers a single bad year, will perish entirely. It will fail to measure itself and act accordingly, and thus be trapped without recourse.

The Dao of Heaven has its established laws; its revolutions are not mere junctures. It is like summer and autumn, when one must exert effort to gather, and winter and spring, when one must live on what has been stored. If one does not diligently gather in summer and autumn, one will starve to death in winter and spring. The celestial texts of the ancients recorded this as the juncture of meeting and parting.

The Perfected One now understands it thus. When the qi of Great Peace arrives, there will be constant equilibrium, and there will be no more deaths at the junctures of the Dao.

Heaven commands the emperor to govern, and thus awakens the virtuous ruler. The common people, in following the Dao, must also glimpse and understand this. Had the people of former times consistently upheld the essential Dao and essential virtue, even if they had encountered such junctures, they would not have perished.

The law by which Heaven commands the emperor to govern the state holds that possessing the Dao and virtue is the greatest wealth, while lacking the Dao and virtue is the greatest poverty. Those who are called lacking in the Dao and virtue will be unable to stabilize Heaven and Earth and will lose them. Former rulers gradually abandoned and severed the Dao and virtue, accumulating over time until the burden was passed on, and later generations suffered its grievous poison and disasters, all because they governed without the Dao. When the revolutions brought annihilation, they could not extricate themselves—the great fault lies here.

Do you understand?”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“How dreadful! How dreadful!”

“Let me further enlighten you, Perfected One. The Dao and virtue are the true heart of Heaven. It is like a person having a heart: if the human heart faithfully guards the Dao, it will always be blessed with good fortune; if the human heart is wicked and does not guard the Dao, it will constantly decline into misfortune. When the spirit of the heart departs, death follows. Thus, when the essential Dao and virtue are severed, people die, and Heaven and Earth fall into chaos and ruin.

Therefore, the Dao makes Heaven, Earth, and humanity share the same concerns and the same tasks, enabling them to alternately generate and complete one another. If they do not share the same concerns and tasks, they will refuse to alternately generate and complete one another, and instead will worry for and benefit one another. Thus, the Dao and virtue bind them to share the same fate.

For this reason, when Heaven and Earth see people possessing the Dao and virtue and doing good, they rejoice greatly; when they see people doing evil, they become enraged. Do you understand, Perfected One?”

“Indeed, indeed. How dreadful! This foolish one is deeply afraid.”

“If you know to fear this, then you may attain long life without misfortune. If you do not know to fear it, then Heaven has already begun to turn away from you—you must be deeply cautious.”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“Let me further clarify this for you, Perfected One. The course of good and ill fortune is like the relationship between the Dao, virtue, ritual propriety, and punishments. If people uphold the Dao, virtue, and ritual propriety, then punishments will not arise. If they lose the Dao, virtue, and ritual propriety, then punishments will emerge.

Thus, those who guard the good Dao find the path of misfortune naturally severed; it departs without needing to be taught to leave. Those who guard the path of misfortune find the path of speech naturally severed. This is like the sun rising and the stars fleeing, or the stars appearing and the sun setting—they do not err by even a fraction.

“Excellent! Excellent!”

“Now let me reveal a great secret to you, Perfected One. People today are deeply foolish and benighted, passing down warnings to one another that the cycles of time naturally bring good and ill fortune. If this is so, what benefit is there in doing good? What harm is there in doing evil? If the cycles of time are natural, what use is there in striving to do good?

Yet those who are sagely constantly align with the heart of Heaven, teaching people to do good—this is correct. To speak of the cycles of time and thereby disrupt the Dao of Heaven is a doctrine that causes Heaven and Earth to remain perpetually displeased. In truth, it is human conduct that brings these outcomes, yet people claim that the cycles of time are naturally adverse. Unwilling to admit their own evil, they instead accuse Heaven and Earth of being evil. It is like a wicked and unfilial child who, unwilling to admit his own faults, instead accuses his parents of being evil. Thus, Heaven is constantly pained, enraged, and sorrowful. Because of these cycles, it strikes down and contends with them, delighting in the transformation of their kind.

In the past, it was not merely a matter of following one another in succession—when the old departed, the young grew up, each exhausting their allotted lifespan and undergoing transformation. It is like the changes in human form since the opening of Heaven and Earth.”

“Excellent! This foolish one has gained great clarity on this: though the forms of people past and present differ, their *qi* is the same.”

“If you wish to know this more deeply, consider the *qi* of the four seasons and the positions of the Five Phases. Though their external manifestations differ, internally they share the same *qi*, alternately generating and completing one another. It is like the head and feet of a person, which do not resemble each other, yet internally they unite to form a single being.”

“Excellent! Excellent!”

“Let me further enlighten you, Perfected One. When Heaven accumulates resentment because people do evil and then claim that the cycles of time are inauspicious, the *qi* of the Supreme August arrives. It should assist the virtuous ruler in governance, but I fear that the people of this age will not change their conduct, persisting in evil deeds that disrupt the proper *qi*, and thus destroy the treasures of Heaven. Therefore, I have been sent down to produce writings for the virtuous ruler, to enlighten the multitude and cause them to constantly follow my texts in their conduct, so that they no longer distress Heaven and Earth or violate Heaven’s prohibitions.

From this point onward, practice my celestial texts, and the spirits will assist the virtuous ruler in governance. Those who violate them will be punished; if people do not punish them, the spirits will. Do you understand?”

“Indeed, indeed. I dare not violate them.”

“Very well, our discourse is nearly complete. Reflect deeply on the essentials of this text.”

“Indeed, indeed.”

*Rising*, I ask the Heavenly Master: “The talismanic strategies of the twelve thousand states each have different meanings. Where should they be placed? And according to the customs of each state, with what should one begin? With the *qi* of fire arising in the southeast beneath the Northern Dipper. I wish to hear the secret meaning of this.”

“The fire is yang, and its talisman now governs the heart of Heaven. Harmony governs bestowal, opening governs communication, and clarity governs the management of all affairs. Fire is the heart, and the heart governs the spirit. Harmony can be the chief of transformation. When all affairs are about to arise, they begin from the heart. The heart governs correct affairs, relying on benevolence to bring clarity, and it also possesses the radiance of the spirit.

The twelve thousand states, though their strategies differ, are unified in using these texts to present memorials and petitions. The *qi* of Heaven will naturally follow and flow through them. Perfected One, you must rouse yourself to promote this. Do not oppose it, or you will perish. It is because Heaven delights in producing these texts that I have been made to speak.”

*Stopping*, if you do not believe my words, seek confirmation in your own person. If you practice them, disasters will daily diminish—this is Heaven’s delight in their practice, and thus disasters are removed. If you do not practice them and suffer many illnesses and calamities, it is because Heaven is enraged and sorrowful, and you obstruct its Dao.

Do not ask others about the misfortunes of fire; seek verification here, as clear as the sun and moon. What Heaven wishes to do, you must not be careless about. If you do not practice or comply, it will cause the hearts of people to be disturbed. Perfected One, be cautious.”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“Very well, let me admonish you once more, Perfected One. If Heaven does not wish it to be practiced and you alone practice it, you will suffer illness. My texts take this as their proof. From now on, it will always be so. The texts have been repeatedly emphasized; I will not add more words to make the Dao difficult to understand.”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“Very well, let me admonish you once more: these disasters and illnesses are not the fault of the people of this single age. Their origins are ancient and far-reaching. Do not suddenly harm them in return.”

“Only by following the Way of Heaven can these be dissolved and extinguished. This is what it means to align with the will and intent of Heaven. If you do not act according to my texts and instead rashly impose harsh punishments, disasters will multiply day by day, and Heaven will not be pleased. Perfected One, do you understand?”

“Indeed, indeed.”

**Fire Qi and the Rectification of the Spirit Way, Scroll 135**

“May I ask: in ancient times, when the Fire phase prevailed, it coincided with Great Peace, yet the Spirit Way was not rectified. Why does the Heavenly Master now uniquely command the rectification of the Fire phase’s Spirit Way?”

“Excellent is your question! Thus it is: a hundred people have a hundred intentions, a thousand people have a thousand intentions, ten thousand people have ten thousand intentions—each employs different strategies, all distinct. Hence, most fail to align with the will and intent of Heaven. What you say is correct. Now, the Fire qi is at its most flourishing, and the qi of the Supreme Sovereign arrives, yet all remain in servitude. In ancient times, the Fire phase came after the qi of Great Peace—a state unseen since the opening of Heaven and Earth.”

“Why must the Spirit Way be rectified when Fire qi is flourishing? I wish to hear your reasoning.”

“Ah, Fire is the heart of Heaven. The heart governs the spirit; when the heart is upright, the spirit is properly luminous. Thus, Heaven has sent me down to govern the Spirit Way.”

“But the Spirit Way is inherently numinous—why must it be governed?”

“Excellent is your question. The spirit is Heaven’s upright official. Now, with many wayward spirits, the true spirits cannot hold their proper places. The Spirit Way within Heaven is thrown into great disorder, and all lose their proper abodes. Today, the qi of Heaven is unbalanced, and the Emperor is distressed by this, yet people do not grasp its essential meaning. You wish to delight in knowing its [obscured text]—this is like the case of humanity. Now, many wicked people occupy positions of power and together disrupt the Emperor’s governance. If upright people cannot hold their proper places, Heaven and Earth lose their rectitude through wayward qi. When the wayward are many, they jointly harm the upright; when the upright are many, they jointly suppress the wayward. These two principles are the natural arts of Heaven and Earth. Do you understand?

Thus, the Great Yang has never been more flourishing. Yang is called spirit, and so Heaven is spirit. Yin is called wayward, and so perverse qi constantly moves through the Yin, never daring to act openly in daylight. If the perverse act openly in daylight, it is called Yin usurping the path of Yang. If illness arises in daylight, it is called the flourishing of Yin and the loss of the Way of Yang—a sign that the ruler’s power has long been in decline. Therefore, Heaven has sent me to rectify the Spirit Way, so that such things dare not occur again. Do you understand?”

“Indeed, indeed! Excellent, excellent!”

**The One Hundred and Thirty-Sixth Formula: The Supreme Equilibrium of Qi and the Absence of Parasites**

“May I ask: when the Supreme Equilibrium of Qi prevails, nothing remains untreatable. Thus, the Heavenly Master examined the sores, scabies, and parasites that consume people. Is this the sole test of its efficacy? What of the other parasites?”

“Excellent! You now ask as a true person should. Does Heaven send illness to instruct you in this? Heaven deeply abhors human wickedness—when corrupt officials and people defy Heaven and Earth, conspiring to deceive their superiors, concealing their perverse deeds in darkness, accumulating like parasites devouring a person. Heaven loathes this. Thus, it compels you to question this repeatedly.

Now, when parasites consume a person, this is what is meant by ‘parasites governing the person.’ Such calamities are most severe, for they invert qi and disorder the upright. Yet when the Imperial Equilibrium of Qi prevails, such manifestations should not occur.

True Person, you have been entrusted with the Power of the Sovereign. Do you wish to understand the thorough harmony of the Dao? Then know this: among the people, the names of all parasites—great and small, those that cause harm—have been shifted. Sores, epidemics, wounds, and scabies, along with all parasites of the three worms within the abdomen, have had their names reassigned.

Where the shift is most extensive, the land below teems with parasites governing people. Where these parasites are absent, none below are governed by parasites. Where they are few, few parasites govern people.”

“Excellent! Yet this humble student, dull and ignorant, once believed this to be the natural order of Heaven. Why, then, does it now require remedy?”

“How foolish you are—why do you suffer such acute pain? Among all things under Heaven and Earth, humans are most noble, while parasites are most base. Yet they devour humans—this is the inversion of the upright. It mirrors the wayless vile preying upon people.

Thus, Heaven clearly perceives this inversion and commands the worthy and sagely to devise strategies to restore the upright. All calamities and anomalies manifest according to their kind, which is how the sages of antiquity came to understand them. Without such categorization, no strategy can be conceived.

Those that conceal themselves within do so in imitation of the lowly who conspire in secret, daring not to appear outwardly. The outward is Yang—Yang is Heaven, the ruler. Heaven rightly governs the Emperor. Thus, parasites that flee inward to secretly consume people mirror the worthless ministers who hide within to gnaw away at the people in secret.”

“How terrifying! This humble student is deeply alarmed.”

“That you fear Heaven is indeed right; had you not feared Heaven, you would long since have perished. Sage, take heed.”

“Indeed, indeed. Thus in antiquity, those who governed brought forth the true spirits to govern, summoned ghosts to govern, employed things to govern, and used insects to govern—what was there to fear? I wish to hear of this.”

“Now, the spirits act in accord with Heaven’s heart and share the mind of the divine. Thus the spirits are Heaven’s envoys, and Heaven cherishes them. Ghosts, in their movements, evade human dwellings; lurking in the Yin’s midst, they whisper in secret like specters—hence summoning ghosts. Things, in their movements, deceive their superiors together, cunning as creatures—hence employing things. Insects, in their movements, covet profit from people and together covet profit from their superiors, their motives as tangled as brambles—hence using insects. Heaven’s transformations respond to each in kind, all following this pattern. The Virtuous Lord of Great Peace, upon receiving the celestial writings of the empire, traced the origins of all calamities and anomalies to report them—how truly divine! ”

“Excellent! Excellent! The qi of calamity has now been thoroughly examined and harmonized.”

“How do you know this?”
“I have witnessed the Celestial Master’s rectitude and thus know that never again will insects devour people—hence the harmony.”
“You may indeed be said to grasp the intent of the Way!”
“May I ask: what do the repeated characters govern? They govern the guiding of rectitude, and guiding rectitude opens the spirit to contemplation. When one enters the chamber with them, they serve as a protective contract—how is this done? Might I hear of it?”
“Yes. It is easily understood yet profoundly subtle; these words are light in form but weighty in meaning and must not be recklessly transmitted. Those who are refined ingest them and are called ‘spiritual’; those who are unrefined ingest them and are called ‘unspiritual.’ Those who are unrefined and ingest them speak recklessly. Thus the Way is transmitted only to the proper person. In all matters, clarity comes only when the right person is found; if not, it is called reckless action, and the fault returns to afflict the one who acts. Does the Perfected One understand this?”
“Indeed, indeed. I dare not act recklessly and sincerely entrust it to the proper person.”

“Thus I speak to you of it: take cinnabar as the character, placing it first above, then proceeding downward to instruct others. One must first bathe and purify the essence, then face north, west, south, and east to declare it. Make the offering solemn with fine wine, as clear as water once drunk. Contemplate the character, and for all time let it serve as the guardian of the body. Moreover, when one faces true rectitude, the qi of goodness arrives, illness is dispelled, the complexion becomes ever more lustrous, and if one sees the character, one contemplates it according to where the ailment resides—this is called ‘returning the essence to nourish the form.’ Even those without illness who practice this grow daily more tranquil. If the body harbors strong malevolent spirits or creatures, they may resist and contend, though their fury remains unchanged. Persist in contemplation without wavering, and in time they will be subdued and depart.

“From this point onward, Heaven delights in those who act with uprightness. If one employs other texts, the celestial spirits will also aid those below, moving as human intention directs. The superior person, upon seeing others ingest the character, returns to contemplate it likewise and can teach it with every ingestion. Thus it is said: the Way of Heaven moves in a single day. My Way does not rely on mere words but establishes resonance with the Way of Heaven, harmonizing as an echo—this is what is called ‘spiritual.’ Perfected One, be cautious.

“Once the celestial spirits are opened, the Way returns to the Lord of Virtue, who entrusts it to the worthy and good. People stand upright on their own, benefiting the clarity of governance above. The enlightened master of the Lord of Virtue instructs with awe-inspiring solemnity. All that is declared becomes real, and all that is witnessed of the divine must not be spoken of. Through this, the superior person attains deliverance from the world, the middling person reaches non-action, and the lesser person achieves steadiness. What each person gains varies in depth, for the celestial spirits decree it according to the talismanic writings. Thus it is said: do not transmit it, for the contemplation must not differ. If it differs, it cannot be spoken of.

“How true! How easy! Such is the Way. How essential! How concise! Such is the aspiration for longevity. Those who study it will naturally align themselves, naturally become good, and possess divine clarity, transforming their hearts and minds to find joy. Some may ingest my character today and later teach others with different texts, instructing ten, a hundred, a thousand, ten thousand, all in accord. The Way operates in an instant, circulating throughout the eight directions and the six conjunctions, with spirit and essence following to heal illness.

“From this time forward, the people of the world will all early rectify their conduct, delighting in the true texts and no longer engaging in deceit or falsehood. If the Perfected One wishes to bring peace to the Way of Heaven and Earth and swiftly rectify illness, the threefold Way of circulating texts should come first.”

“I wish to hear of this precedence.”
“Excellent, your inquiry is apt. The foolish are difficult to correct, and their self-inflicted chaos troubles the Lord of Virtue. Thus the circulating texts are placed first, causing those above and below, great and small, to correct one another, sparing the common people from the harm of solitary words and contentious scholars.”

“Excellent! Excellent! I wish to hear why the threefold Way of circulating texts must have many documents with preceding and following texts, rather than a single transmission.”
“Excellent! Excellent! Your words align with the intent of Heaven. The reason for preceding and following texts with difficult questions is to make the common people deeply aware of their faults. The great illness of isolated speech lies in not recognizing the evil of solitary words and single texts, and thus one cannot perceive the goodness of collected circulating texts. Without transmitting their errors and distinguishing their great faults, the heart cannot be liberated—only then can it be saved. If the heart is not liberated, one does not understand one’s actions, and the error grows over time. When the human heart awakens, rectification becomes easy.

“All my writings follow this principle, not only this one. Do you understand?”
“Indeed, indeed.”
“Go, you have understood. Perfected One, be cautious in your affairs. The written texts are sufficient; do not lightly ask repeated questions. I was reluctant to explain further, fearing it would trouble you, yet I wished to expound further for your sake. Now, the great texts of the Way, like the Way of Heaven, cannot be exhausted in phrases. If one grasps their intent, Heaven rejoices greatly; if not, one opposes the Way of Heaven, incurring fault and offending Heaven. I dare not speak further. Go.”

Right Great Compendium: Difficult Questions on the Destruction of Heaven and Earth, the Rise of the Sun, Moon, and Stars, Eclipses, Violent Deaths, the Strategies of the Twelve Thousand States, Talismanic Scripts, and Divine Formulas
*Collated and Combined Text of the Scripture of Great Peace, Scroll Ninety-Three, Ji Section, Part Eight*
*Scripture of Great Peace, Scroll Ninety-Three*
*Divine Formula for Reciprocal Treatment through Suppression and Consolidation, One Hundred Thirty-Seventh*

“Now, this foolish student has obtained the written texts of the Heavenly Master, collated various scriptures and medical formulas, and retired to a quiet place to distinguish and ponder their essential meaning. Yet there remains a doubt I cannot resolve, and I humbly request to ask one matter.

Today, the Heavenly Master has collated various formulas, stating:
- Those with a ten-out-of-ten cure rate are formulas by which the celestial spirits effect the treatment;
- Those with a nine-out-of-ten cure rate are formulas by which the terrestrial spirits effect the treatment;
- Those with an eight-out-of-ten cure rate are formulas by which human spirit and essence effect the treatment.
Those below this are not to be used.

This foolish student believes that only by obtaining the awe-inspiring power of suppression and consolidation can reciprocal treatment be achieved; without obtaining this power, reciprocal treatment cannot be achieved.”

“Excellent! The Perfected One has spoken, grasping the difficult intent.”

Yet, beyond the boundless caverns of the unseen, all that the eye beholds and the ear perceives—every creeping, crawling thing—is born of Heaven. Were Heaven not to generate it, it would not exist. Thus, each possesses its own presiding spirit, to which its fate is bound. Consider the six domestic beasts: their fate is tied to humankind, their life and death resting solely in human hands. Humankind, then, is the spirit that governs their destiny. All twelve thousand things in the world receive their mandate from Heaven and Earth and move accordingly. Were even one thing lacking, the celestial mandate would be incomplete, and so they are made to govern and subdue one another. Moreover, each is assigned its own hierarchy of rank and lordship, enabling the Dao of Heaven to regulate all things through mutual governance. Those formulas with a ten-out-of-ten cure rate—achieved by invoking what they fear—are precisely those whose fate is bound to Heaven. Does the Perfected One understand this?

“Indeed, indeed.”

“Go then, for you have grasped it.”

“I beg to ask one more doubt, though it may seem impertinent—dare I speak?”

“Proceed without hesitation.”

“If a bandit robs another, they are both subject to humankind—how can this be called a mandate from Heaven or a lordship ordained by fate?”

“Excellent! A keen challenge indeed. The bandit who robs another acts without righteousness, wrongfully subduing their fellow for a fleeting moment, never to hold dominion long. The moment they overpower another, grave transgression follows, and the authorities pursue them relentlessly. How can you claim this is Heaven’s mandate? When a true ruler governs the people, are they ever hunted down? All people are born to recognize the ruler as their lord and the arbiter of their fate. Does the Perfected One now comprehend?”

“I understand fully.”

“Well said, well said! Let the diligent scholar refine this understanding and not raise reckless questions, for Heaven is not as mortals are.”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“If there has been any offense, take heed—be mindful and do not speak as carelessly as the common folk.”

“Indeed, indeed. This foolish student often errs gravely in speech. Yet if I remain silent, I will never come to know the truth. Now, I wish to ask another question but hesitate to speak abruptly.”

“Proceed.”

“If all things each have their own lord, do Heaven and Earth also have a lord?”

“Ah! What a profoundly subtle and far-reaching question you pose!”

“Now I realize my questions were immodest and fell short of the Master’s depth of inquiry—thus I failed to grasp the truth.”

“Indeed. Heaven takes the Central Ultimate, the highest of all, as its lord; Earth takes Kunlun’s Waste as its lord; the sun takes the King Sun as its lord; the moon takes the Great Moon as its lord; the stars take the Central Ultimate Star as their lord; the many mountains take the Five Peaks as their lords; the Five Peaks take Mount Tai, beneath the Central Ultimate, as their lord; the hundred rivers take the Yangzi and the seas as their lords; creatures with shells take the divine tortoise as their lord; those with scales take the dragon as their lord; winged fliers take the phoenix as their lord; furred beasts take the qilin as their lord; naked creatures take humans as their lord; and humans take the emperor as their lord. Such hierarchies in the world are too numerous to recount—yet I have merely outlined their guiding principles and shown their origins for the Perfected One. Do you now understand?”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“You ought to ponder deeply on this meaning, though it cannot all be committed to memory—it would be difficult to exhaust its practical applications.”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“Now, I speak of creatures that crawl and possess awareness: those that dwell within one’s own body accomplish their tasks without need for prompting. Why should one recklessly kill or harm them? The lord fears that such acts may provoke the wrath of their superiors. In this era of Great Peace, when the qi of harmony prevails, one should join with a virtuous ruler to govern with concerted effort, refraining from wanton injury. To do otherwise would disrupt the qi of Great Peace and throw governance into chaos.”

“How could such small creatures possibly move Heaven to disorder, causing governance to fall into chaos?”

“Alas! You remain as one benighted, still far from true understanding. Each of these has its own lord and superior—just as the lowliest and most despised people in the distant frontiers are to the emperor, so too are the most wretched of men to the tiniest ants.
