In that age—like the Three Sovereigns and Five Emperors—they acted by the true Dao, striving to benefit and never to harm. Thus they practiced the true Dao openly, without concealment.

When the Three Kings brought chaos and the Five Hegemons arose, rulers and ministers and common folk deceived and slighted one another. Hence the false feigning of madness, the fear of being recognized, the beggary, the eating of filth and drinking of urine—these were the conduct and speech of the destitute, the desperate. The Dao, too, has its cycles of decline and flourishing, like the Three Sovereigns, Five Emperors, Three Kings, and Five Hegemons.

In the Latter Era, the way of hegemony prevails: beggary, abandonment of kin, casting off of wives and children, eating filth and drinking urine—these mark the decline of the Dao and the rise of hegemony. Thus the Three Sovereigns and Five Emperors often attained the Dao and ascended to Heaven, some through corpse liberation, others by bodily departure. The Three Kings died at the end of their allotted years, while none of the Five Hegemons obtained the true Dao; all perished in battle upon the wilds. Now, in the Latter Era, those who cling to this hegemonic way shall likewise perish upon the wilds—this is what is meant.

I do not deceive you, Perfected One: this, too, is a hegemonic path, no different from that of the hegemonic kings. How could one ascend to Heaven by such means?”

“Excellent! Excellent! The confusion in this foolish student’s heart is now truly dispelled. I never imagined the Dao could have a hegemonic aspect. Only through the Celestial Master’s explanation have I come to understand.”

“Truly, truly...! You may be said to have awakened.”

“May I ask: what should learners of today do?”

“Now, the great cycle of the Heavenly Dao is complete and fully arrayed. From this time onward, it differs from the past. If one seeks to practice the hegemonic methods of the Middle Era, the true Dao will not come. Perfected One, be vigilant and cautious!

If you desire long-lasting joy and preservation, cultivate my texts. Lose but a fraction of a *zhū*, and your life will not be whole—how can you fail to guard it?

The primordial Dao has arisen in its august aspect; the fire-light proceeds, and the hegemonic way is severed. Though Heaven is vast, it has its own principles of division, manifesting texts to all people that they may deliberate together. What belongs to the high should be assigned to the high, what to the middle to the middle, what to the low to the low; what should be shared by high, middle, and low should be so shared. Why do you not perceive its sincerity and trustworthiness...? It is like speaking with Heaven itself.”

“Excellent! Excellent! The qi of the times is now balanced.”

“How does the Perfected One know this?”
“I saw Heaven personally dispatch the Heavenly Master to descend and speak, and thus knew the qi of Heaven is balanced.”
“Excellent! Excellent! You have grasped its meaning.”
“I humbly request to ask one or two more questions, daring not to speak excessively.”
“Proceed with the Way.”
“From this time onward, where should all who seek the Dao turn?”
“All should seek it in secluded chambers, without abandoning parents or departing from wives and children. Proceed gradually, and only cease when seclusion is complete. If one’s inner nature is not virtuous yet seclusion is forced, no benefit will come—rather, one may die prematurely. Each must examine their own truth and act without betraying Heaven. People may be deceived, but Heaven cannot be deceived; do not fear others acting wrongly. Let each govern themselves by this principle. Those who dare not practice the Dao are wicked people, those who wish to deceive and feign. Judging by this, not one in ten thousand will err. If learners are thus, deceit and cunning will vanish, and the good and evil among people will be plainly seen. This is called *The August Heaven’s Selection of the Worthy*, a text by which the highest may attain transcendence of the world, the middle may serve as counsel to emperors and kings, and the lowest, though ignorant and obstinate, may become prudent folk among the people. Perfected One, take heed of this.”
“Indeed, indeed.”

“May I inquire how one with deficiencies and leaks may attain the Dao and depart?”

“Simply put, when the Dao is accomplished, one departs—nothing more. If the Dao is not yet accomplished, one should daily serve their parents, protect their wife and children, and proceed gradually with purity and stillness. Day by day, one will come to understand their own intent. The worthy together uphold this teaching.”

“Indeed, indeed.”

---
*[Right] Celestial Writ for the Selection of the Worthy: On the Interruption of the Dao and the Abandonment of Hegemony to Preserve Life, Easing the Heart and Dissolving Cunning, Serving Parents and Protecting Wife and Children*

**Volume 118 of the *Tai Ping Jing*, Geng Section, Part 16**
**Scroll 118 of the *Tai Ping Jing***
**Scripture 290: The Prohibition Against Burning Mountain Forests**

“May I ask the Supreme Celestial Master of the Highest Cavern: though this humble and unworthy student does not dare hope for it, the Master has graciously taken pity on my foolishness and deigned to speak of celestial matters. Having already granted this, you have opened the path for me to know the affairs of Heaven. I wish to inquire: what does the Heaven above delight in, and what does it forbid? I seek only its prohibitions, that I may day and night ponder their meaning, never dare transgress them, and pass them on to later generations.”

“Excellent is your question, for it grasps the essential meaning. Perfected One, be seated, and I shall expound it for you—a teaching that may be transmitted for ten thousand generations, never to fade.”

“Indeed, indeed. I receive your command with profound gratitude.”

“No need for thanks. You inquire on behalf of Heaven and Earth, and I, as the agent of Heaven, speak—not for your sake alone, but for the common good. Why should you thank me?”

“If I do not thank you, it would seem I take the Dao lightly and make light of your labor. Yet if I thank you, it may touch upon taboos and seem immodest.”

“It is only that I fear the text will grow too lengthy and the words too numerous, making it difficult to comprehend. Thus, I limit my speech to the Perfected One. Words are the handle of the Dao, the origin of all scripture—do not be disheartened, for I shall now distinguish these matters for you.”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“Now, in the Heaven above, the Primordial Qi of the Supreme Sovereign arrives in full flourishing. The yang sun shines brightly, perverse qi ceases and rests, upright qi prevails, and decay dissipates—this is the yang of virtue and the Dao.

“Why does Heaven above strictly forbid the burning of mountain forests and thickets? I wish to hear the reason.”

“Mountains are the great yang, the warp of the land, its ruler. Trees, spreading their roots, are its elders—also its rulers, its yang. Fire, too, is the ruler and elder of the Five Phases, its yang. Three rulers, three yangs, when they meet, instead weaken one another. Thus, Heaven urgently prohibits the burning of mountain forests and thickets. If trees are not burned, they remain within yin. Yin is called ‘mother,’ and thus leans downward.”

“Why does Heaven cause the branches of *zi*, *chou*, and *yin* to first sprout and flourish abundantly, so that fire reigns and the sun grows brighter? Why do *bing* and *ding* flourish, and *si* and *wu* rejoice? I wish to hear the reason.”

“This is the celestial pattern, its nature. When the mother is abundant and reigns, her children prosper. When the children prosper, they receive qi for a long duration and attain longevity. Thus, Heaven prohibits this. When yang flourishes, the perverse yin dissipates daily; when yang wanes, the perverse yin arises daily. Therefore, cunning and deceit always arise in the dark of night—this is the great proof that when yang wanes, perversity arises. Thus, Heaven desires to eliminate perversity and forbids this. Such is the natural method and law. What holds true in the Heaven above also holds true on Earth below.”

“Excellent! Excellent!”

“May I ask why the convergence of the three yangs leads to misfortune and decline?”

“Excellent is your question—you have grasped its essence. Now, the three yangs correspond to the yang of Heaven, the yang of Earth, and the yang of Man. All three are entirely yang, without a trace of yin; all three are entirely rulers, without a single subject; all three are entirely male, without a single female. This is the path to annihilation, the Way without posterity. It dares not transmit its kind, nor can it mutually generate and complete. Thus, it is inauspicious. This is what is meant by having Heaven but no Earth, having the sun but no moon, having the above but no below, having the exterior but no interior. In Heaven above, this is called the ‘Cycle of Imminent Ruin,’ and thus it is detested and forbidden.”

“Excellent! Foolish as I am to have asked this, I am deeply alarmed.”

“To know alarm is the root of life; not to know alarm is the gate of misfortune.”

“Indeed, indeed.”

---

**Method for Burning the Grass of the Lower Fields (Section 210)**

“May I ask whether the grass of the lower fields may be burned?”

“Heaven above does not forbid burning. It should be burned.”

“Why, then, should it be burned? I wish to hear the reason.”

“Now, grass is the yin of wood and corresponds to *yi*. Wood corresponds to *jia*. *Jia* is yang and of the same kind as wood, thus they correspond. *Yi* is yin and of the same kind as grass, thus it corresponds to *yi*. *Yi* fears metal, and metal injures wood. When wood is injured, yang declines; when yang declines, perverse and cunning things arise. Thus, it should be burned.

Furthermore, Heaven above says: *Yi* is yin, grass is yin, and the lower fields are the yin of earth. When the three yins converge, they jointly give rise to perversity. Thus, the Dark Warrior dwells in the northern pole of yin, and at the extreme of yin, yang is reborn. Fire is yang, and when yin obtains yang, it follows auspiciously, generating good affairs. Therefore, Heaven above teaches to burn the grass of the lower fields to please yin and invigorate yang. Thus, it is burned. What holds true in Heaven above also holds true on Earth below.

*Jia* is the wood of Heaven above. *Yi* is the grass of Heaven above. What of *yin* and *mao*? Now, *yin* is also yang—the wood of Earth below. *Mao* is yin—the grass of Earth below. These four all move eastward. Yet yang is called wood, and yin is called grass. This is the natural law, the classic of Heaven above. I dare not deceive you, Perfected One.

You inquire of Heaven to resolve doubts, and I expound the affairs of Heaven. Together, we share the duty, jointly ordering yin and yang, eliminating the maladies of Heaven and Earth, ensuring the Emperor and kings suffer no hardship, and enabling the twelve thousand things to each attain their place. None will fail to emerge in joy, and there will be no grievances or entanglements.”

“Excellent! Excellent!”

“Now, Perfected One, you may be said to have grasped the Dao.”

“You are too kind, too kind.”

“Now, in learning and inquiring of the Dao, what offering do you make in gratitude?”

“As you command.”

“Bind it to your heart and mind, never to depart.”

“Excellent! Excellent! Your learning and inquiry have attained their proper measure.”

**Heavenly Spirits Examine and Record: The Threefold Concordance Formula, Scroll Two Hundred Eleven**

“Now, the harmonious and balanced qi of Heaven above has arrived, yet I constantly fear that the people may inadvertently violate the seasonal ordinances and harm it. Today, all the spirits of Heaven record those who delight in killing and wounding, the sons who hunt, shoot, fish, and trap, those who defy the Dao of Heaven and do no good, who constantly take pleasure in killing and wounding. Heaven deeply reproves them, Earth deeply abhors them, and the host of spirits deeply condemns them. Now, I fear that petty men, accumulating folly, can no longer be restrained, jointly polluting and disrupting the pure and balanced qi of the Cavernous Sovereign. Thus, today’s great urgency: the spirits are dispatched to record them, following their conduct day by day, even in small matters, to examine and assess them. Three years, including intercalary months, form one intermediate reckoning; five years, one great reckoning. Those with grave transgressions are punished accordingly; those with minor faults have their years diminished and their allotted lifespan reduced. Every three generations, a great rectification occurs; every five generations, a great eradication. Therefore, today Heaven gathers the three Dao to issue documents, and the host of spirits jointly records transgressions, cutting off the practice of killing, wounding, and penal punishment, while fostering joy. The same holds true on Earth.

Perfected One, fortunately incline toward goodness, ever desiring to hold virtue before August Heaven, and pitying the Emperor and kings in their sorrow and hardship when the seasonal qi is disharmonious. The fault truly lies with those who delight in killing and wounding, hunting, shooting, fishing, and trapping, jointly enacting penal punishments, constantly harboring hearts that oppose Heaven and Earth. Thus, long-standing disorder and disharmony persist, and Emperors and kings, past and present, suffer sorrow and hardship—this is a grave transgression.

Perfected One, if you would ever render merit to Heaven and bestow favor upon the Emperor and kings, today Heaven accumulates its grievous malice. The host of spirits instructed me in these words, and thus I now transmit this document to you, Perfected One, to return it to a virtuous ruler and display it to all under Heaven. Let each person, upon receiving this document, deeply reflect, ponder their faults, and heed the words of Heaven. Now, the harmonious and balanced qi has arrived in full, and it does not favor those who act with malice and harm. Knowing that Heaven above holds these words, how dare I not transmit them below? To remain silent would be to act with malice and harm, bringing calamity upon myself. I dare not transgress, and thus I report these matters. All Perfected Ones, be vigilant. If a Perfected One does not speak, harm will befall you; if you display it to the common people and the foolish still wish to transgress, harm will befall them, and Heaven will no longer hold the Perfected One accountable.

From this day forward, Heaven will activate the host of spirits to conduct examinations and govern the people. In Heaven above, the three Dao gather to issue documents recording transgressions; the spirits likewise issue documents in three Dao to record transgressions; thus, people also issue documents in three Dao to record transgressions. Therefore, people take their pattern from Heaven, and Heaven takes its pattern from people. Heaven, Earth, and humanity each have their affairs, modeling themselves on the numinous spirits and likewise patterning their affairs after their laws. Thus, ghosts and spirits, with their essence and qi, admonish humanity, and admonition constantly arises simultaneously in Heaven, Earth, and humanity.

Therefore, spirits respond to Heaven’s qi and act; refined beings respond to Earth’s qi and arise; ghosts respond to human governance and contend. These three are the agents of harmony and disharmony in Heaven and Earth, moving in accordance with the spirit-qi, responding to the seasons as they come and go, traversing the Cavernous without interruption, their comings and goings difficult to discern. Thus, today’s Dao of transmission and governance differs from that of ancient times. Using the present to prognosticate the past often misses the mark, and using the past to prognosticate the present no longer corresponds. Thus, ancient texts have declined and are difficult to employ; using them does not yield accurate results. Yet there are places where true and authentic documents are gathered.

Therefore, Heaven above speaks of examining and recording the threefold concordance of past and present, selecting the best from the middle to clarify affairs and align intentions. Only then will the Dao of Heaven be upright, the kingly Dao complete, all evil and wickedness dispelled, the Emperor and kings filled with great joy, and affairs at peace. People, acting with caution, will naturally accord with Heaven’s intent.

Perfected One, do you grasp the gravity of these matters?”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“Excellent! You have comprehended their meaning.”

The right [section] speaks of Heaven’s prohibition of fire to foster life, severing punishments that wound and kill, and halting hunting and archery that violate the seasonal qi—all recorded here as acts Heaven abhors. *True Texts of the Great Peace: Collated and Aligned*, Scroll 119, Geng Section 17. *Scroll One Hundred Nineteen of the True Texts of the Great Peace*. "The Three as One Household: Yang Fire’s Number Five Formula," Two Hundred Twelfth.

“A humble one of lowly birth ventures to ask: Now that the Dao of Heaven is complete, nothing is absent, and nothing is not encompassed.
What does Heaven observe, that it suddenly desires all life to flourish while urgently enforcing punishments?”

“Excellent is your challenging question—it grasps the meaning.
I have always deeply cherished your words.
Your words constantly rouse my intent, causing my Dao to flourish.
If even you cannot pose such a challenging question, who else could?
Thus, the Dao of Heaven has long been severed, obstructed, and uncommunicated, and Heaven suffers grievously from this.
I have long been despondent, wishing to speak but having no one to address, so the Dao of Heaven has lost its proper order for ages.
Year after year, up to the present, Heaven has sent forth sages to speak, yet none have fully resolved its afflictions.
Therefore, it has now caused a Perfected One to come and meet me, so that at last I may fully discourse on Heaven’s behalf.
Your challenges alone deeply accord with Heaven’s intent. Sit at ease, and I shall exhaustively expound the Dao for you.
I wish not to speak, but I fear Heaven’s majesty.
Thus, whenever you ask, I am compelled to speak—nothing may be concealed.
Does the Perfected One also understand this?”

“Indeed, indeed.”

Indeed, you have understood well.

Now, the reason Heaven above desires all things to be fully born and grow, yet urgently harms and injures them, is that the Dao of Heaven invariably regulates the three qi. The first favors generation and is called yang; the second favors completion and is called harmony; the third favors destruction and is called yin. Thus, Heaven presides over generation, while humankind presides over nurturing and completion—completion is called destruction, and destruction is called concealment. Heaven, Earth, and humankind share this common work, their affairs mutually dependent. Without yang, nothing is born; without harmony, nothing is completed; without yin, nothing is destroyed. These three are interdependent as one household, together bringing forth the twelve thousand things.

Yet the Dao of Heaven is rooted in the mean. Now, since the Dao of Heaven first arose, it has completed a great cycle and returned, coming to belong to humankind and to yang. Yang favors generation and abhors destruction; what is generated requires joy, and only then can hearts unite to mutually engender. But if destructive qi intervenes and injures, they cannot generate or complete. If you wish to know its truth, consider the child in the womb: even a slight harm will cause injury and death, and once dead, it cannot be revived. One is cast aside, and this leads to unceasing injury, resulting in extinction without posterity—one household is cut off and lost. Thus, the urgency of harsh punishments and destructive harm is especially great.

The Dao of Heaven is not always like this. Now, the urgency is even greater, so I shall make it clear and distinct for the Perfected One to discern, that people of later ages may fully awaken to the Dao of Heaven. Now, I do not wish for destructive harm to sever the intent, which is why I speak so clearly for the Perfected One. Common people follow me, but they merely engage in empty literary embellishments and crafty speech. Therefore, I shall further expound the evidence of Heaven’s judgment.

Now, at the *jiazi* inception, Heaven is aligned—on the day of the winter solstice, it begins to return to its origin. At *yichou*, Earth is aligned—things spread their roots. At *bingyin*, humankind is aligned—at dawn, people rise, open their doors, and attend to their duties. These three together are the beginnings of Heaven, Earth, and humankind, the root of all things. The inception of generation belongs to yang, and yang is the primordial qi of Heaven, Earth, and humankind. Thus, *qian*, *kan*, *gen*, and *zhen* reside in the northeast, with harmony at their center, between *kan* and *gen*, where yin and yang unite to generate at the center.

Thus, all who conceive dwell in the middle of the abdomen, slightly below the center of harmony, between head and feet. When yang unites, it generates first, issuing forth its form and qi, casting them to other regions. This is where the three qi of Heaven, Earth, and humankind first arise, where things begin anew. Above and below, there must be no destructive or harmful qi residing within. Only when virtue and yang qi are established can the myriad things attain their full generation; if inauspicious qi intervenes, they are injured. Thus, destructive influences must be expelled.

Now, the Dao of Heaven has completed a great cycle and begun anew, with pure yang governing Heaven and Earth above and below. Therefore, punishments must be urgently abolished. Heaven is called spirit, and yang is also called spirit. Thus, Heaven now sends spirits to govern humankind. Does the Perfected One wish to know whether my writings align with Heaven? From now on, those who violate my writings and favor harsh punishments and destruction will be examined by Heaven above. People will also urgently condemn them, and spirits will examine them. Though Heaven above and Earth below are in different realms, they conspire as one; though ghosts and spirits do not share a household with humankind, they too conspire together. This is the advent of Heaven’s balanced qi.

The inception of Heaven’s qi begins anew above, the inception of Earth’s qi begins anew below, and the inception of humankind’s qi begins anew at the center. These three qi now arise together, and they do not wish to encounter destructive or inauspicious qi—they all desire to encounter joyful qi. Thus, from now on, Heaven and Earth will joyfully abolish punishments. Does the Perfected One understand?

“Indeed, indeed.”

“Foolish and benighted as I am, I had thought that Heaven above swiftly punishes those who do evil and prohibits injury through punishments and killing. I never imagined that this concerns the primal qi of Heaven, Earth, and humankind in their gestational embrace, the very origin of renewal. Hearing the Celestial Master expound this, I am deeply awestruck and ●.”

“That you are awestruck and ● shows you have awakened and grasped the intent of the Dao of Heaven. Excellent! Take heed of this text and its warnings, and be careful never to sever it, lest you harm yourself.”

“Indeed, indeed. I dare not, I dare not.”

“Go forth and hold it in high regard. In all learning and inquiry, each person acts for their own sake, striving to align with the Dao of Heaven.”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“Do not conceal these Heavenly prohibitions and taboos.”

“Indeed, indeed.”

“May I ask why the Dao of Heaven now designates this time as the great cycle, the primordial beginning, and why it meticulously examines and rectifies the texts?”

“Excellent is your challenging question—it aligns perfectly with the heart of Heaven. Now is the ascendant phase of the Five Yangs, the inception of the Five Fires. The supreme Fire ascends to become Heaven, embodying the radiance of the sun and moon. Fire is red, as is Heaven; Heaven’s hue is red, and so is Fire’s. Red is the color that befits the numinous. Heaven and the numinous endure perpetually, attaining the origin of all things. Thus, the eleventh month marks Heaven’s reckoning, and so it is above as well. Its qi is red, and red signifies the sun’s return. Its initial nine qi belong to *jiazi*, the foremost of the Six *Jia*s. *Jia* embodies essence, the heart of all matters, and thus *jia* emerges first from *zi*, ascending to become the Heart Star. Therefore, the spirit of Fire resides in the human heart. The human heart, as the seat of the numinous and sagely, is the most revered and truly good. Thus, the sagely heart of the numinous can create and initiate all things, serving as their primordial origin. 〈Thus〉 the law of the numinous and sagely begins with the heart, and nothing remains unexplained. The most flourishing of the red is Heaven, the sun, and the heart. Heaven, the sun, and the heart are ever luminous, illuminating all without exception. Henceforth, those who practice this Dao will utterly eradicate all that is wicked and perverse. The generation of Yang occurs within the depths of darkness. Thus, Yang qi arises in the north, emerges in the east, flourishes in the south, and wanes in the west—such is the law of Heaven 〈concluded〉.”

“Excellent! I wish to know why the birth of Yang now occurs precisely within the depths of darkness.”

“All that is born returns to its origin; only when Yin and Yang unite can life arise. Thus, all that is born reverts to its initial beginning. When Heaven and Earth were undivided at their inception, there was neither above nor below, neither sun nor moon nor the Three Luminaries. All was profoundly dark, without distinction or principle. Though without division or principle, within it inherently existed above and below, left and right, exterior and interior, Yin and Yang, all held in mutual balance yet undifferentiated. When Yin and Yang first coalesced to give birth, their emanation was undivided, without distinction. Only after birth did head and limbs take form. How do we know the initial generation of Yin and Yang was thus? Therefore, when humans undergo transformation to give life, they all withdraw into secluded, dark places—Heaven ensures they do not forget their origin. The initial reception of Heaven and Earth’s law is their primal state, and thus Heaven ensures they do not forget.”

“Excellent, excellent! Hearing the August Celestial Master’s words, I now understand the principle of division.”

“You may be said to have been easily enlightened.”

“May I ask why Yang and Fire are uniquely paired?”

“Each qi has its own pairing; it is not Fire alone. Metal and Fire are most closely paired, as the foremost of the Red Emperor. Does not the Heavenly Strategy text state: ‘*Bingwu* and *dingsi* are the ancestral beginning’? ‘Beginning’ means first, foremost, and thus the text speaks of the ancestral beginning. The inception of all things arises from the red heart. The heart illuminates and comprehends all matters. Yang arises within Yin, and it too illuminates. Thus, water is dark externally but bright and illuminating internally, for it contains Yang essence. Therefore, Yang begins in the north, while Yin begins in the south. In the eleventh month, the earth below is warm; in the fifth month, the earth below is cold.”

“Now, why do Yin and Yang originate not in Heaven above but within the midst of Earth?”

“Excellent is your challenging question. Earth is the mother; the father’s essence is bestowed upon the mother, and thus it occurs within Yin. The emanation of Yang essence begins simultaneously in Heaven. Yang, as the transformative inception of qi, is subtle and difficult to perceive. It takes form within Yin and only then becomes visible and manifest. Thus, records note its presence within Yin, not its Yang origin.”

“Today, rain and snow—both manifestations of this transformative Dao—are visible and spoken of. Yet the emanation of Yang essence is imperceptible?”

“Excellent are your words, for they grasp the intent. I wished to explain this to you as a Perfected One, but I feared the great form of the Dao of Heaven would be revealed, and thus I did not speak. Yet I feared you would harbor resentment. It is difficult to be a teacher, to be one who guides others. Please sit calmly, and I will explain subtly. When Heaven creates rain and snow, it is merely the interplay of breath—Yin and Yang unite and emanate, becoming visible at that moment. Heaven’s qi descends, Earth’s qi ascends, and their emanations converge. Thus, rain and snow take form and are visible.”

“May I ask: when mountains crumble and clouds rise, all is visible. Yet you say the emanation is imperceptible—why? I could not help but ask, for my heart was heavy with unease. As a disciple, is it not improper to be immodest? Yet if I do not ask, I cannot attain understanding. Thus, I must ask without hesitation, leaving no doubt.”

“Very well. I will explain subtly, though it cannot be fully exhausted.”

“Now, when clouds and rain cause mountains to crumble, this is the overwhelming fury of Yin, which cannot restrain itself from harming Yang—a transformation of ominous events, not a virtuous change. It injures the Dao of transformation, a failure of Yin, a wound to Yin. True One, do not press further with questions; the Way of Heaven cannot be exhaustively examined or fully spoken. Reflect upon its meaning yourself.”

“Understood, understood.”

“You may go.”

**Daoist Protection: Three Persons’ Parting Words, Two Hundred Thirteen**

The True One bowed again. “I humbly ask the Heavenly Master about the Dao. When the Qi of Great Peace arrives, who is suited for the Dao? Who is not suited for it?”

“Excellent, your question is well put. The Dao and people are like wind and rain: those who practice it prosper, those who do not simply remain as they are. Those who delight in practice are its people; those who do not delight in it are not its people. Those who practice without strain, who find it easy to open and penetrate, are its people. Those who remain closed and impenetrable, achieving nothing all day, are not its people. Practicing brings good fortune; not practicing brings misfortune—such are its people. Those who do not practice yet remain naturally fortunate and free from suffering are not its people. After practicing, if one instead suffers afflictions, they are not its people.

Furthermore, in nurturing oneself, one must examine carefully. The Dao is the tally of the upright person. Illness, demonic influences, and malevolent spirits are the pathways of wickedness, thieves that murder good people. When they see someone about to enter the true Dao, they grow enraged, contend with them, and turn their pursuit of the Dao into misfortune rather than virtue. They feign tranquility among equals—one must be meticulous and refine oneself. Attaining the Dao brings good fortune; losing it brings misfortune. The mandate of life and death cannot be altered carelessly or without careful consideration.”

“Excellent! Excellent! Your foolish disciple now understands.”

“Very well. Since the True One has asked about these matters, I will now impart the essential words of Heaven. The reason my Dao endures and nurtures is that there are those who delight in the Dao, delight in virtue, delight in benevolence, who disregard worldly affairs and seek only to preserve life. The Dao truly endures in nurturing and guarding these two kinds of people. Those who fall below this standard cannot be long nurtured by my Dao.”

“Why is this? The Dao of humanity encompasses all—why does it uniquely favor these three kinds of people and not others?”

“Excellent, your challenging question has grasped the meaning. When the Great Dao emerges, all people receive its grace, even grasses and trees—none fail to be transformed for the good, all attain their proper place, and each fulfills its natural lifespan.

Those without Dao, virtue, or benevolence cannot be long nurtured. Why is this?”

“Because they do not delight in Dao, virtue, or benevolence.”

“Why can those who delight in Dao, virtue, and benevolence alone be long nurtured? I wish to hear the meaning.”

“Ah, you understand the arising of things! Your question touches upon the ultimate secret. Listen carefully, and I will distinguish its meaning for you.”

“Understood, understood.”

“Now, those who delight in Dao, virtue, and benevolence—these three kinds of people each possess the mandate of the Three Powers. Those who delight in the Dao belong to the mandate of Heaven; those who delight in virtue and nurturing belong to the mandate of Earth; those who delight in benevolence belong to the mandate of humanity. These three kinds of people align with the harmony of Yin and Yang, all have their names recorded in the registers. Thus, the myriad spirits of Heaven say my scriptures can nurture them. Those who do not act accordingly have no record in the registers, so my scriptures cannot long nurture them.

Now that the Qi of Great Peace has arrived, there is no partiality, so it does not long nurture the wicked. It is not like the times of internal chaos in the past, when it could encompass and nurture evil people.”

“I wish to hear the full explanation.”

“Very well. When the qi of wickedness and evil arises, it can long nurture evil people but cannot long nurture good people, for their harms are many and the good are few—like the arrival of great cold when the heat wanes. Now that the upright qi has arrived, it cannot long nurture evil people—like the arrival of Yang qi when Yin qi dissipates.

When the great red qi of the Supreme Yang rises, it is the sovereign essence of fire. The sovereign of fire ascends to become the sun. The sun illuminates and examines evil people, so they cannot act wrongly—thus, it does not tolerate evil people.

Moreover, the Dao governs life, virtue governs nurturing, and benevolence governs the application of the heart in love. Spring brings life, summer brings nurturing, and humanity applies the heart to govern and nurture all things. Thus, the Supreme Yang gives life, nurtures, and grows, applying the heart with the greatest toil. This is what is meant.”

“Excellent! Excellent!”

“Foolish student, I hear your request again!”
“Very well, sit calmly, and I shall further expound for you.”
“Yes, yes.”

“First, in the study of the Dao, those of great attainment reside in Heaven, those of middling attainment reside among the spirits, and those of lesser attainment reside among men. Second, in the study of virtue, those of great attainment reside in Heaven, those of middling attainment reside among the spirits, and those of lesser attainment reside among men. Third, in the study of benevolence, those of great attainment reside in Heaven, those of middling attainment reside among the spirits, and those of lesser attainment reside among men. Fourth, in the study of office, those of great attainment reside in Heaven, those of middling attainment reside among the spirits, and those of lesser attainment reside among men. Fifth, in the love of amassing wealth and property, those who amass greatly reside in Heaven, those who amass moderately reside among the spirits, and those who amass little reside among men.

Thus, in these five matters—whether of great, middling, or lesser attainment—all depend on the devotion of one’s strength: dedicating one’s fate to Heaven, dedicating one’s virtue to Earth, and dedicating one’s benevolence to men. If one guards these three matters in cultivating the self, with a worthy heart and good intentions, pondering and reflecting upon them, the self may be perfected. By accumulating and gathering them, the spirit will naturally arise; by guarding and nurturing them, the Dao will naturally be achieved; by delighting in and cherishing them, the self will naturally flourish.

The Way of Heaven is without partiality or estrangement, bestowing its trust upon the good. Thus, Heaven exerts itself to enact the Dao, completing one cycle each day. The reason for this daily cycle is that all things’ generation follows the six jia, the five phases, and the four seasons. If one qi fails to arrive, things will be incomplete, and their generation will be insufficient and unbalanced. For a ruler, parent, or superior, this imbalance is a grave transgression.

Thus, Heaven completes one cycle each day, personally overseeing its enactment. The reason it personally oversees this enactment is, for example, if you are Water: should the qi of Water be incomplete, the qi of the five phases will be insufficient, and the qi of the four seasons will be unfulfilled. Therefore, it enacts and oversees them. When jia aligns above, there is the phase of Wood and the qi of spring. When bing aligns above, there is the phase of Fire and the qi of summer. When wu aligns above, there is the phase of Earth and the qi of the four seasons’ center. When geng aligns above, there is the phase of Metal and the qi of autumn. When ren aligns above, there is the phase of Water and the qi of winter. When the five phases are complete and the four qi are established, all things may be generated.

When Heaven and Earth’s transformative influence is evenly bestowed, whether noble or base, great or small, all are as one, and there are no disputes. Thus may one be a ruler or parent. Those who embody the Dao, virtue, and benevolence must model themselves on this. Only then may they accord with the will of Heaven; they must not act carelessly or recklessly. The Way of Heaven serves as this model—how much more so for man?

Thus, the superior person models Heaven—this is the Dao! The middling person models Earth—this is virtue! The inferior person models men—this is benevolence! Those who fall below this are no longer among men; they share the impermanent fate of beasts, plants, and trees.

The Perfected One who obtains my writings must deeply ponder their essential meaning. If he follows them without fail, he will harmonize with Heaven and share its work. Those who oppose my writings are the enemies of Heaven and Earth, and I will not tolerate them. What my writings detest is precisely what is right. Perfected One, be cautious, and transmit this to the superior person, return it to the authorities, and show it to ordinary people. From this day forward, Heaven differs from ancient times.”

“Excellent! Excellent!”

Here follows the Right Section distinguishing the proper and improper applications of the *Taiping* texts—*The Comprehensive Collation of the Taiping Jing*, volumes 120 to 136, Xin section, unnumbered scrolls; *Excerpts from the Taiping Jing*, Xin section.

Someone asked: To be sated without eating, to enjoy long life and enduring existence—this is the Way to enrich the state and preserve the people.

If one wishes to cease eating, one must first employ the method of guiding life, placing it foremost, and thereby retain qi. After ingesting qi-nourishing medicines, one feels slight hunger on the third day, mild hunger on the seventh, and by the tenth day, one achieves small success without doubt—having left death to join life. After ingesting qi-nourishing medicines, for all solid and difficult-to-digest foods, one meal suffices as the measure. For formless foods, moderation in small amounts is best. Beyond a hundred days, one may cease eating entirely—this is called the inexhaustible Way, the means to assist the state in nourishing the people and aid Heaven and Earth as the masters of sustenance. Too little is auspicious; too much is inauspicious; complete abstention is also inauspicious, for it obstructs the intestines. The method for unblocking the intestines: one meal is proper; two meals are excessive; three meals are inferior; four meals distend the intestines; five meals bring great hunger; six meals invite great misfortune, and from this arise a hundred illnesses, leading to death in years of great famine.

After regulating food for a thousand days, the large and small intestines are fully filled, never to be depleted. All illnesses depart, one’s complexion improves, and nothing is forbidden. In ancient times, those who attained the Dao all did so by ceasing to eat. Rulers, ministers, and common people can thereby secure body and mind, fulfill their duties, the wealthy can preserve their wealth, and the poor can sustain their lives. The superior person who practices this thrives in good years and avoids peril in bad ones.

People say there are three lives, yet they do not know it: daily three meals sustain life. Skipping breakfast severs one life; skipping lunch severs two; skipping dinner severs all three. Going three days without food severs nine lives. Hoarding goods and treasuring wealth arise from hunger. Great deceit and wickedness all begin here.

By employing this Way, all affairs regulate themselves. In auspicious years, one can promote prosperity; in inauspicious years, one can preserve the people. One should always lightly bind the intestines to facilitate movement.

Between Heaven and Earth, all things possess their own spirit. Radiance ascends to Heaven, becoming stars by which one may observe safety and danger. The nature of Heaven and Earth has its own patterns and laws—six jia, five phases, four seasons, and seasonal measures—by which one may divine and foresee future events, remedy decline and disorder, and prevent what has not yet occurred.

In seven matters, a minister observes the ruler’s decline and rescues him, restoring his prosperity—this is a great merit. Knowing the decline yet failing to rescue it, or instead speaking ill and departing, is called inciting calamity, and the guilt is ineradicable.

In the second matter, a minister knows the ruler’s faults, foresees impending harm, and rescues him, averting misfortune—this is a great merit. Knowing yet failing to rescue is called inciting misfortune, and the guilt is ineradicable.

In the third matter, a minister knows the ruler has lost the essential meaning of governance, with disasters arising in succession, and assists in rectifying it—this is proper. As an enlightened minister, knowing yet failing to rescue incurs ineradicable guilt.

In the fourth matter, a minister knows the ruler is young and his virtue insufficient for governance, and rescues him, aiding his understanding—this is proper. Knowing yet failing to assist in cultivating virtue, instead claiming incompetence, is called disloyalty, weakening one’s superior, and the guilt is ineradicable.

In the fifth matter, a minister knows the ruler is aged, nearing the end of his Heaven-appointed span, and worries for him, seeking extraordinary methods and great worthies to assist, offering unusual strategies and inner texts, enabling the ruler to extend his years—this is a great merit. Knowing yet failing to act, instead speaking of fortune and misfortune, incurs great fault.

In the sixth matter, as a subordinate, one knows one’s superior is in danger, has lost proper governance, or has forgotten something, and jointly rescues and rectifies it—this is a great merit. Knowing yet failing to rescue, excusing oneself and departing, is to be an unfilial and disloyal person, and the guilt extends to one’s descendants.

In the seventh matter, when parents are ill, one divines and observes, exhausting all effort and spirit to rescue them. Knowing yet failing to rescue brings great punishment from Heaven.

In the eighth matter, when parents are aged and nearing the end, as a child one knows their time is approaching and seeks worthy teachers and extraordinary methods to restore their vigor—this is the duty of a filial child. This is like consuming another’s food and returning it as sustenance, and it is a great merit.

In the ninth matter, knowing someone faces decline, great harm, or impending suffering, one rescues them, restoring their prosperity, offering unusual strategies, inner texts, and good deeds to eliminate their worries—this is a great merit. Knowing yet failing to act incurs ineradicable guilt.

As a child, to abandon parents in their hour of mortal peril, seeking comfort while shunning hardship, is to be no different from beasts and plants. How can one govern the Three Powers or succeed Heaven and Earth?

Thus, when sages emerge, they enact teachings and admonitions, exhorting people to goodness, cutting off wickedness, and rescuing Heaven and Earth from disaster, so that the Three Luminaries, Five Phases, and stars proceed in proper order. Is this mere empty talk?

Now, the texts above have fully emerged to transform and eliminate all disasters, bringing about goodness. Therefore, I myself enlighten and instruct the Perfected to reveal these writings. Now, the heavens above teach me great words, forbidding concealment or secrecy.

Now, Heaven and Earth have completed a great cycle and begun anew. Disasters and harms are about to vanish, leaving no remnants. Thus, people are taught to compile and collate ancient and modern texts, selecting the good to form the *Scripture of the Utmost Depth*, establishing goodness that cannot be altered again. Even sages and worthies cannot surpass its words.

These words are the language of Heaven and Earth, yin and yang. Thus, rulers and worthies are taught and admonished, urged to diligently practice and bring about the Great Peace.

Thus, when it speaks of concealment, it means that the worthy ruler, having obtained these teachings, conceals them within his heart to apply them throughout the world, nurturing the myriad things to bring about the Great Peace. Attributing merit to the Supreme Emperor, they are then secured in stone chambers and deep caves. Heaven generates good things, which must be returned to good places. Like pearls and jade, they are treasured by emperors and kings. Coarse and vile things, however, are discarded by the multitude. How much more does Heaven cherish those who do good? How could emperors and kings not hold them in esteem?

Now, above is the Heaven of the Utmost Limit, at the center is the Heaven of the Utmost Limit, below is the Heaven of the Utmost Limit, and extending in all directions is the Heaven of the Utmost Limit. Today, the law is established, and moreover, the three Dao gather qi to deliberate together, corresponding to the positions of Heaven, Earth, and humanity. When the Great Peace arrives, Heaven rejoices, and the emperor’s longevity is assured. The Dao of the numinous spirits protects Heaven and Earth; good qi responds without fail. Virtue and power arrive daily, while deceit and falsehood retreat, and inauspicious ministers and treacherous officials perish. All corrupt ministers are eradicated, and the myriad virtues arise of their own accord. The Five Phases harmonize, and the four qi align with the seasons.

In governance and law, one must begin with the root. The root lies in the human image of the spirits between Heaven and Earth. The spirits resemble humans, each possessing their own domain. They gather and assess the good and evil, the likes and dislikes, the joys and sufferings of villages, districts, towns, and counties, each according to its root. Matters are examined closely, and their strengths and weaknesses, gains and losses, are as clear as the sun and moon. Thus, great teachings assemble deliberations, where the worthy and the unworthy together balance affairs.

Therefore, in every prefecture, county, town, and village under Heaven, seals are placed, and the myriad people are encouraged to write according to their abilities, speaking directly of their sufferings, benefits, harms, and preferences. They submit their writings into the sealed receptacles. Local officials then compile and present them to the Son of Heaven, allowing him to know the people’s likes and dislikes, worthiness and unworthiness, benefits and harms, so that they may be deliberated and governed. When this is done, the qi of Great Peace arrives, blessing the state, the ruler, and the myriad people, and the twelve thousand things each find their proper place. The seal is what is now called the *guǐhán* (the sealed petition box).

The Dao of Heaven has its slow and swift moments, and human affairs are likewise slow or swift. When the Dao of Heaven is swift, wind, rain, thunder, and lightning arrive without delay. When human affairs are urgent, they too are addressed without delay. Urgent matters are promptly reported in accordance with Heaven’s laws, with one copy submitted and another returned to the original office, where rewards and punishments are meted out. Slower matters are to be reported within eight months, as a single day in Heaven’s law. Such is the law of yin and yang, and so too is the Dao of humanity.

Within each person’s abdomen resides a Son of Heaven, and the five qi each have their rulers. Heaven has the five qi, and Earth has the five positions. One qi governs movement, and the ruler governs the execution of justice. All matters reside within the human abdomen, where the heart is named. The heart is the ruler of the five viscera, the root of the spirit, and the essence of the body. It governs the execution of goodness and does not delight in reckless internal deceit or evil. If a person can uphold goodness, dwell in clarity and stillness, refrain from reckless external pursuits, and align inwardly with the ruler within, this is called clarity that returns to behold the heart. The heart is the ruler; when one meets it, life is prolonged, and all affairs are governed rightly. Those who fail to meet the ruler are all deceived; they no longer communicate with the ruler, and all their affairs go awry, leading to early death.

Now, the virtue of the Great Yang is flourishing, desiring that above and below, within and beyond the heavens, there be no bounds. The true spirits and true essences radiate their light to assist the emperor in governance, bringing forth the qi of the Supreme Sovereign’s Utmost Peace, which has never before been seen. The lives of good people are prolonged, and the myriad things no longer suffer untimely deaths or self-inflicted injustices. Malevolent spirits vanish entirely, and there are no more cases of oppression or illness under Heaven. How could this not be heard?

Excellent is your question! Heaven commands the complete eradication of deceit, falsehood, and vicious evil, revealing true affairs. All paintings and diagrams possess their own spirits: true affairs have true spirits, false affairs have false spirits, good affairs have good spirits, and evil affairs have evil spirits. Those who accumulate falsehoods will inevitably suffer harm, while those who accumulate true texts and the true Dao will later achieve transcendence. Thus, truth and falsehood each manifest according to their essence.

Heaven has the auspicious and the inauspicious: the auspicious has auspicious spirits, and the inauspicious has inauspicious spirits. Earth likewise has the auspicious and the inauspicious: the auspicious has auspicious spirits, and the inauspicious has inauspicious spirits. The Three Sovereigns and Five Emperors each had their kin and brothers, as did the Three Kings and Five Hegemons. Minor distinctions follow their kind: when the age flourishes, they rise; when the age declines, they fall. Like day and night, they follow one another in succession, continuing without cease from the opening of yin and yang to the present. The poor become petty men, and the rich become noble men, alternating in their governance and management. This is the kinship of Heaven and Earth. Though the myriad things do not arise, some resemble them in form, yet they are not the same.

Heaven has the six jia, the four seasons, the Five Phases, the firm and the yielding, the female and the male, the first, middle, and last months, all forming kin and brothers, revered and served without fail to transform the world. They are made to govern with goodness, and benevolence, righteousness, propriety, wisdom, culture, and martiality become kin and brothers in turn. The Dao and the Dao are kin and brothers: all Dao ultimately unite as one, mutually proving and generating one another. Today, if one’s body has attained the Dao, all Daoists come forth, and kindred spirits unite as one family, all harboring good intentions. Great and small no longer harm one another, and disasters and calamities depart without trace. If the emperor practices this, the world flourishes. He governs effortlessly, transcends the world, and enjoys long life. If officials and people practice it, governance becomes daily clearer. All Dao emerge, and none fail to radiate light. The Dao and the Dao transmit and practice together as kin. Thus, summoning the Dao with the Dao and seeking the Dao with the Dao, the Dao becomes kin and brothers. When transformation reaches such a state, the world cherishes life and detests killing. How could there be those without the Dao?

When virtue unites with virtue as kin and brothers, if one’s body today embodies great virtue and takes virtue as its intent, all virtuous people defer and serve one another with humility, and all virtuous people in the world emerge. Taking this as the rule, one sits at ease without trouble. If the emperor practices it, his state prospers; if officials and people practice it, nothing remains ungoverned. Summoning virtue with virtue, virtue comes of itself.

When benevolence unites with benevolence as kin and brothers, if one’s body today embodies benevolence, all benevolent people come seeking one another. Summoning benevolence with benevolence, all benevolent people come forth. If the emperor practices it, the world becomes wholly benevolent; if officials and people practice it, none fail to cherish one another. This is what it means for benevolence to unite as one family—kin and brothers.

When rightness unites with rightness as kin and brothers, summoning rightness with rightness, if one’s body today has attained rightness, all people of rightness come to submit, for they unite through rightness. If the emperor practices it, suffering and joy are evenly divided; if officials and people practice it, life and harm are evenly split. Summoning rightness with rightness—this is kin and brothers.

When ritual unites with ritual as kin and brothers, summoning ritual with ritual, if one’s body today has attained ritual, all people of ritual come forth. Those who practice it uphold restraint; the living are not at ease. Within, the belly is empty; without, one moves as if encircled, rushing, bowing, rising—never hearing commands. Days grow short, and clothing becomes threadbare. If the emperor practices it, he is beset by sorrow and vexation; if officials and people practice it, duties multiply endlessly. The strong grow weary, and the old and weak strain their sinews. Ritual uniting with ritual—this is kin and brothers.

When culture unites with culture as kin and brothers, if one today has attained culture, summoning culture with culture, cultured people come like floating clouds, accumulating within and without like mountains. If sincerity is lacking, great deceit arises. If the emperor practices it, he governs with mixed success; if officials and people practice it, they deceive one another, vainly posturing, giving rise to countless harms, illnesses, and calamities—people’s lives grow ever shorter. Expecting culture from one another, threatening one another with culture, they take and generate endlessly—this is the kinship of culture.

When martial force unites with martial force as kin and brothers, if one today has attained martial force, summoning martial force with martial force, all martial people gather. Their qi is fierce and blazing, their weapons gleaming, their strength doubled, their eyes wide and glaring, their rage uncontrollable. Martial spirits dwell at their flanks, seeking only victory, sparing no thought for their lives. If a noble ruler practices it, his governance grows daily more violent; if officials and people practice it, they destroy and slaughter the world. No goodwill remains, and governance breeds only harm—this is martial force generating martial force, the kinship of martial force.

When eloquence unites with eloquence as kin and brothers, if one today has attained great eloquence, all eloquent people come to submit. Eloquence begets eloquence without end: one word becomes a hundred, a hundred become a thousand, a thousand become ten thousand. Words flow ceaselessly, tongues tangled in chaos, with no truth to be found. If the ruler practices it, his governance becomes boundlessly complex; officials and people have no place to entrust their lives.

When eloquence seeks eloquence, they become kin and brothers. When laws unite with laws as kin and brothers, today they have become the law. Seeking law through law, all those of the law in the world gather. Matters great and small all have governance, and there are no people without guilt. From birth to old age, how many transgressions does a single person commit? There are none without guilt. When people are thus generated from one another, nineteen out of twenty noble men meet violent deaths. Using this to govern the world, great chaos cannot be stopped. When kin and brothers seek one another, each follows its kind. The root of order and disorder, the foundation of Great Peace—examining these nine matters, one may know.

The gods in heaven say: Those who delight in practicing the Dao, the qi of the Dao of Heaven and Earth emerges to assist them; those who delight in practicing virtue, the qi of virtue assists them; those who practice benevolence, Heaven bestows the qi of benevolence to assist them; those who practice righteousness, Heaven bestows the qi of righteousness to assist them; those who practice ritual, Heaven bestows the qi of ritual to assist them; those who practice culture, Heaven bestows the qi of culture to assist them; those who practice eloquence, the qi of eloquence also assists them; those who practice law, the qi of law also assists them. Heaven and Earth each act through their kinds with divine efficacy. When Heaven is about to assist them, spirits and deities hasten to them. Deeply pondering their essential meaning, the qi of Great Peace can be immediately attained.

I ask: Is supreme goodness easy to achieve, or is supreme evil easy to achieve? The extreme of yang is goodness; the extreme of yin is evil. The extreme of yang gives birth to immortals; the extreme of yin kills beings—these are the extremes of yin and yang.

Now, the common people in life cannot exhaust their efforts to nourish their parents, yet they seek rare methods and Daoist arts to provide for their parents, causing them to harbor sorrow until death. They then teach one another to enjoy fine clothing, food, singing, and dancing to please them—these are the people of great rebellion. How could Heaven bless them?

Heaven above emulates the written words of the mortal world. Today, Heaven has established a law forbidding celestial beings from conspiring in deceit, for there are great arts to this. The same holds true on Earth. Do the perfected ones of today know this?

From ancient times to the present, there have been many flattering ministers and deceitful men who manipulate rhetoric to jointly deceive their superiors, distressing their lord and father to obtain office. They consume emoluments without merit before Heaven and Earth. Heaven deeply abhors them; Earth deeply detests them. In Heaven, they are named "disruptors of order." Today, the qi of equanimity from Heaven is about to sever them, yet it fears these men will again disrupt governance.

People today accumulate folly, and many can be deceived into obtaining office. But today’s celestial disasters cannot be deceived and averted, nor can they be eliminated through fraud and pretense. The true and the false resonate with Heaven. If I do not fully reveal this to the people of later ages and test its use, disasters and harms will all be eliminated—this is the true scripture of mine, resonating with the laws of Heaven above. There can be no doubt.

If I do not speak yet the opposite is said to be manifestly clear, or if it is used without success, then my Dao is false—this, too, would be manifest without words.

Heaven’s law does not emulate clever words but emulates success and accomplishment. It is like sitting facing the sun or moon, both possessing light and brightness. How does one know their heat and clarity? They are too distant from people. How to verify this? The master lies in success: sitting facing the sun, one knows warmth; sitting facing the moon, one knows clarity. My true scripture is also like this.

Heaven’s law: when the eyes are open, one governs yang; when closed, one governs yin. When open, one governs the formed; when closed, one governs the formless. When open, one governs the human body; when closed, one governs the spirit. Using this as verification, one can govern both yin and yang completely, so there are no derelictions of duty. The same holds true on Earth, achieving the ultimate, imperial, and equitable.

Today, the books that emerge from Heaven, the divine strategies and sacred talismans that emerge from spirits, the writings and scriptures composed by sages, and the words of the highest worthies—these are all words. Thus, the gods, sages, and superior scholars of Heaven and Earth exert themselves for humanity, accumulating words over the years. They can establish Heaven and Earth and eliminate disasters and harms. When emperors and kings follow and employ them, they attain carefree wandering without affairs, ascend to immortality and increase their years, gain Heaven’s favor, and their descendants continue without end. When the world declines, they can again bring about great flourishing. The world looks up to their mandate, and none fail to attain the six directions, eight distant reaches, and the utmost depths of Heaven and Earth. Yin and yang are both pleased, Heaven’s illnesses and untimely winds and rains cease, thunder and lightning do not arise, the sun and moon grow brighter, the Three Luminaries do not lose their courses, the four seasons and five phases proceed in order, each attaining its place. This is the achievement of the sacred and good words—how great is their merit!

The heavens above are each distinct, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The boundless Three Luminaries of Heaven are each distinct, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The central abodes of Heaven are each distinct, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The Three Luminaries of Heaven are each distinct, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The cloud qi of Heaven are each distinct, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The sounds, echoes, thunder, and lightning of Heaven are each distinct, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The winds and rains of the world are each distinct, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved.

At the center of the world, the winds and clouds each differ, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The people upon the earth each differ, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The crawling creatures upon the earth each differ, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The grasses and trees upon the earth each differ, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The mountains and hills upon the earth each differ, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The rivers, valleys, waters, and marshes upon the earth each differ, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. What lies beneath the earth each differs, possessing its own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The boundless yin and yang beneath the earth each differ, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The Five Phases each differ, possessing their own natural qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The four seasons each differ, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The Six Jia and Ten Stems each differ, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The Six Jia and Twelve Branches each differ, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The eight directions each differ, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my written words, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved. The spirits and numina each differ, possessing their own natural primordial qi of yin and yang, resembling my scripture. Each follows its customs, records my words of good and evil, and practices them—then Great Peace is achieved.

If they do not follow the teachings of their original kind, great chaos ensues. Take heed of this!

Heaven commanded me to fully expound this text to resolve the afflictions of Heaven and Earth, yin and yang, emperors and people, and the myriad things. All the sufferings of the people and the myriad things shall be dispelled. Thus, I teach you to employ the boundless method to demonstrate it, having examined and collated the sacred texts of former sages and worthies, as well as the common words of ordinary people. When this is thoroughly investigated, the afflictions of Heaven and Earth shall all be dispelled. Once dispelled, the emperor’s years shall be prolonged, and he shall govern with ease, free from worry.

Heaven is the Great Yang. Earth is the Great Yin. Humans dwell at the center, and the myriad things are likewise. Heaven constantly descends and bestows, its qi flowing downward. Earth constantly ascends and seeks, its qi rising to meet. The two qi intersect at the center. Humans, dwelling therein, are upright. The two qi constantly interact and operate, converging at the center to jointly generate the myriad things. All things receive these two qi to take form, uniting to become their nature and disposition. Without these two qi, they cannot be born or completed. Thus, the lives of the myriad things are bound to these two qi, which intermingle within their forms.

Therefore, when one does good, Heaven and Earth know it; when one does evil, Heaven and Earth also know it. Thus, the ancient people of utmost virtue and power inwardly knew the will of Heaven alone, and so they always acted rightly in doing good.

The celestial prognostication states: "What returns to joy is joy; what returns to goodness is goodness; what returns to evil is evil; what returns to delight is delight; what returns to compliance is compliance; what returns to truth is truth; what returns to the Dao is the Dao; what returns to pleasure is pleasure." Whatever returns, Heaven and Earth and the host of spirits likewise return in echo!

"What returns to refinement returns refinement; what returns to falsehood returns falsehood; what returns to eloquence returns eloquence; what returns to flattery returns flattery; what returns to martiality returns martiality; what returns to rebellion returns rebellion; what returns to misfortune returns misfortune; what returns to depravity returns depravity." Whatever returns, Heaven and Earth and the host of spirits all return it. All the principles of fortune and misfortune, safety and danger lie in what is returned.

Those whose households are strong often amass private wealth, yet later they often suffer poverty and misfortune. Why is this? The divine beings say: This is because some, though wise, deceive those who are lacking; some, though strong, bully the weak; some, though young, disrespect the old—all these are acts of rebellion. Thus, Heaven does not long protect them. Why? The wise should nurture the foolish, yet they deceive them—this is the first rebellion. The strong should support the weak, yet they bully them—this is the second rebellion. The young should care for the old, yet they disrespect them—this is the third rebellion. This is contrary to the heart of Heaven, and thus misfortune must follow.

Wealth is the surplus of Heaven and Earth. It is like water, which constantly flows and follows, always humbly dwelling below. Those who obtain much wealth are those who are humble and thus gain more. Those who are greedy, however, are not protected by Heaven.

Ever since the loss of the harmonious Dao of Heaven and Earth, yin and yang, and the Three Methods, Heaven has accumulated excess calculations, hoarding without bestowing. Why is this? I wish to hear the reason. Now, Heaven’s mandate: the superior reckoning is one hundred and thirty, which is called the surplus of the yang calendar.

The next is one hundred and twenty, called the remainder of the year-count after removing the cycle. The next is one hundred years, called the harmonious calendar’s alignment with the cycle of things. All people should model their years upon this. Since the loss of the Three Methods, many have not completed their allotted years. The surplus reckoning is one year per unit, recorded in Heaven, yet those who act contrary to the Dao of Heaven cannot claim it. Now, those who emulate my teachings and perform good deeds—Heaven will bestow this surplus reckoning upon them, increasing their years, some attaining transcendence, others prolonging their lives.

Since the time when Heaven and Earth [lacuna], emperors and kings have been solely concerned with the inequity of the world, grieving over the loss of proper order. Without this, there would be no cause for sorrow. The world’s good people, loyal ministers, and filial children all share this concern. Yet by practicing my teachings, this sorrow will be dispelled.

Heaven declares: when yang qi flourishes greatly, ghostly beings cannot act recklessly to harm. Why is this? When yang is abundant, yin must wane, so such beings cannot act recklessly—who restrains them? The essence of yang restrains them. How does the essence of yang restrain them? The essence of yang is spirit, belonging to Heaven, associated with red, and governing the heart. The heart-spirit is the spirit of Heaven. Essence is the essence of Earth. Ghosts are the ghosts of humans. Earth is the mother; ghosts are the child. Mother and child follow the same law, dwelling together in the path of yin. When the qi of Great Peace arrives and yang qi flourishes greatly, the Dao of Heaven is stern, and the Dao of spirits is luminous. When luminous, Heaven enables humans to employ it together with the spirits. When the Dao of spirits is employed, it descends to dissolve the path of ghostly beings. When the Dao of spirits flourishes, it aligns with the noble person. The path of ghostly beings aligns with the petty person. Thus, the noble person governs with impartiality, and the spirits likewise govern with impartiality. The petty person governs with deceit, and ghostly beings likewise govern with deceit—clearly, they belong to the same kind.

Now, when the Dao of yang flourishes like fire, weapons and blades will be dissolved, for fire suppresses them. Thus, when weapons accumulate, yin qi is abundant; when fire accumulates, yang qi is abundant. When yang is abundant, it dissolves weapons—this is the natural response. Human life must rely on Heaven’s qi. The most virtuous are entrusted to Heaven, the moderately virtuous to humanity, and the least virtuous to the fields. Therefore, the superior scholar studies to transcend the world; the middling scholar governs the people; the inferior scholar tends the fields and wilds. The superior scholar will come with cloudy qi, the middling scholar rides in a carriage, and the inferior scholar walks. These three types have distinct duties and do not interfere with one another. The superior scholar transcends the world and ascends to Heaven, regulating the winds and rains of harmony; the middling scholar serves as an official, governing the people; the inferior scholar manages property—each has their role and does not interfere.

In the methods of those who study the Dao in Heaven, one must diligently seek the Dao. A small alignment with the lesser Dao allows one to perceive minor spirits and attain minor attainment; the gateway has not yet aligned with the middle Dao, and thus one may progress to the great Dao. Only by reaching the great Dao can one attain the true spirit. Those who align with the lesser Dao attain minor spirits; those who align with the middle Dao attain middling spirits; those who align with the great Dao attain great spirits. Only when the great spirit arrives can one transcend the world and endure forever. Yet even here, there are great demonic spirits and ghosts that do not wish for humans to transcend the world, seeking to delude them into negligence, causing them to retreat and speak of strange transformations, mingling truth with falsehood. Only by distinguishing between the upright and the perverse at this stage can one transcend the world.

In Heaven, the superior scholar, from birth to death, harbors not a single evil thought and is thus beloved by all people. The officials of the four directions and the five regions bestow gifts upon them. The middling scholar is beloved by their neighbors, who together bestow gifts upon them. The inferior scholar, lacking any virtuous intention, receives no gifts but instead secretly takes from their own household to give to others. This is the conduct of the worthless in the world. What is meant by "worthless"? The superior scholar is purely good, their heart free of evil—this is the highest yang. The middling scholar’s heart is half good—this is the middle yang. The inferior scholar’s heart is entirely devoid of goodness—this is the lowest yang, hence called "worthless." Worthless things do not come to fruition, hollow within and without grain, for they lack true sincerity. Those without sincerity are called worthless people.

The gifts bestowed upon the superior scholar’s household by officials from the four directions signify that they do not forget their ancestral origins. The gifts bestowed upon the middling scholar’s household by their four neighbors signify that they do not forget their parents. The inferior scholar, however, secretly takes from their own household to give to others, resembling the worthless—hollow within yet outwardly full, turning their back on their roots. All such actions harm Heaven above, for they turn their back on their household, causing disharmony within. It is from such people that all troubles arise.

When a minister engages in external alliances, their state will surely be emptied; when a household member engages in external alliances, their household will surely be emptied. Heaven’s censure arises from this. For peace and peril originate within the human heart, and the divine and numinous are perceived from afar. Above and below, in all directions, they penetrate countless miles—can one not be cautious?

The Way of Great Peace is concise in its teachings, enriches the state, is Heaven’s mandate, and the treasure of the self. Emerging from the heart and mind, it circulates throughout the world. By practicing these teachings, the state may be secured, and the household enriched. The laws of Heaven and Earth decree that the good govern the evil, the upright govern the perverse, and the pure govern the turbid. One cannot allow the evil to govern the good, the perverse to govern the upright, or the turbid to govern the pure. To reverse this is to invite unending banditry, daily growing deceit, and ultimately great chaos—all arising from this.

When emperors and kings appoint ministers, they must carefully consider their selection, aligning with the heart of Heaven. Only when the constellations align may one dare to appoint them. The sun represents the virtue of the ruler; the moon represents the virtue of the minister. If the constellations do not align, one cannot achieve Great Peace, and deceit will arise.

What do the post stations and lodgings of the eight directions—above and below, central and peripheral—wear, eat, and rest upon? Those who practice virtue and morality yet harbor doubts may resolve them through this prophecy. Today, in Heaven, there are official lodgings and post stations to await and house travelers; on Earth, there are official lodgings and post stations to await and house travelers; and in the eight directions and the center, all have them.

The celestial official lodgings house divine immortals. The earthly official lodgings house sages and worthies. The subterranean official lodgings house the virtuous spirits and benevolent ghosts of the Great Yin. The official lodgings of the eight directions—near and far, in famous mountains and great rivers—house the spiritual beings and immortals between Heaven and Earth who have yet to ascend. Within clouds and winds dwell the Northern Culmen and Kunlun. The official lodgings and post stations await the arrival of sages, worthies, and meritorious spirits.
